13277=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagConsumableSkill_A03Desc=Fortifies the flesh against the wrath of lightning.
13281=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagConsumableSkill_A05Desc=Fortifies the flesh against fiends of the void.
13289=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagConsumableSkill_A09Desc=Coats your weapon with the Lifestealer toxin.
13291=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagConsumableSkill_A10Desc=Coats your weapon with the Venomfang toxin.
13293=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagConsumableSkill_A11Desc=Coats your weapon with the Bloodfang toxin.
13295=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagConsumableSkill_A12Desc=Coats your weapon with an Arcanum elixir.
13297=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagConsumableSkill_A13Desc=Fills you with the power of the Ancients.
13299=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagConsumableSkill_A14Desc=Fills you with the untamed power of the Void.
13301=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagConsumableSkill_A15Desc=Fills you with the raw power of the Aether.
13313=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagConsumableSkill_A21Desc=Suffuses your flesh with a divine light.
13315=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagConsumableSkill_A22Desc=Shatter the crystal formation to release its energies.
13317=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagConsumableSkill_A23Desc=Not for the faint of heart. Side effects may include: nausea
column2: vomiting
column3: forgetting where you were last night.

column1: 13320=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagConsumableSkill_F01Desc=Coats your shield with the Stoneheart concoction.
13324=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagConsumableSkill_F03Desc=Coats your weapon with the Arkovian toxin.
13330=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagConsumableSkill_F06Desc=Fills you and your allies with the will to keep on fighting.
13332=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagConsumableSkill_F07Desc=Coats your weapon with the Heartseeker toxin.
13334=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagConsumableSkill_F08Desc=Surrounds you with swirling blades that strike anything that attacks you.
13336=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagConsumableSkill_F09Desc=Coats your weapon with the Ice-Blood concoction.
13340=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagConsumableSkill_F11Desc=Coats your weapon with oils blessed by Kymon himself.
13342=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagConsumableSkill_F12Desc=An explosion of flame emanates from you.
13348=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuestSkill_A01Desc=Your weapons are blessed with the sacred flame of Empyrion.
13350=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuestSkill_A02Desc=Your weapons are enchanted by the Order.

column2: humanity turns to the stars. Devote yourself to the celestial symbols and deities of old. Reclaim their ancient power.

column1: 13372=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotionAffinity01Info=The quantity of Ascendant Affinity you have harnessed.^n^nAscendant beings have risen to godlike status through immense feats or reverence from their lessers.
13374=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotionAffinity02Info=The quantity of Chaos Affinity you have harnessed.^n^nChaotic beings crave entropy and destruction above all else.

13376=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotionAffinity03Info=The quantity of Eldritch Affinity you have harnessed.^n^nEldritch beings represent the wild forces of magic and the metaphysical realms beyond the veil.
13378=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotionAffinity04Info=The quantity of Order Affinity you have harnessed.^n^nBeings of Order cherish harmony and balance in all things.
13380=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotionAffinity05Info=The quantity of Primordial Affinity you have harnessed.^n^nPrimordial beings embody the powers of creation
column2: life
column3: death
column4: and reality itself.

column1: 13390=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_Requires2h=^oRequires a two-handed melee or ranged weapon.

column2: dagger or caster off-hand.

column1: 13395=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_A01Desc=The vampiric bat easily finds its way across the night sky
column2: hunting for flickers of lost stars to sap of their light.

column1: 13397=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_A02Desc=Akeron was doomed to walk the desert until dead
column2: but fate intervened in the form of a scorpion which led the sun-dazed mortal to water. Akeron survived his sentence and returned to take revenge upon those who had left him to die with the use of scorpion venom.

column1: 13399=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_A03Desc=The raven represents guile. It is for this reason that the witch gods have taken favor in ravens as their familiars and messengers.
13401=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_A04Desc=The hammer strikes down upon the anvil with divine force
column2: forging arms for the gods at Targo's firm grip.
an indispensible tool in Targo's celestial forge.

column1: 13405=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_A06Desc=The shepherd guides his celestial flock across the night sky.
13407=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_A07Desc=The sailor's guide serves as a celestial marker for those lost at sea. Its guiding light has saved many a sailor braving the tumultuous waters.

column2: the favored tool of the sanctioned killer.
the witch god
column3: is said to have peered beyond the veil and witnessed the truth of all things. For that
column4: the gods have cursed his mortal form into a spined abomination with a thousand lidless eyes. He now stands immortal guard over the veil
column5: his peerless gaze ever watchful for those who would dare follow in his stead.

column1: 13413=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_A10Desc=The falcon's sharp gaze scans the skies for easy prey.
13415=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_A11Desc=The eel glides gently across the night sky
column2: its slick form impossible to grasp.

column1: 13417=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_A12Desc=The owl represents wisdom and scholarly pursuits. Spellwork is believed to be more potent under the gaze of the owl.
13419=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_A13Desc=The viper represents the flow of energy between the living world and the aether
column2: which powers all forms of magic.

column1: 13421=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_A14Desc=The gallows is a solemn sign of passed judgement and deadly portents.
13423=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_A15Desc=The crossroads mark the changing of ways
column2: the opening of endless possibilities.

column1: 13425=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_A16Desc=When Rhowan of Arkovia abdicated his throne
column2: the seat of power remained vacant until the fall of the once great nation as its oligarchs bickered amongst themselves for power.

column1: 13427=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_A17Desc=The plague rat skitters across the night sky
column2: careful to avoid the gaze of the falcon and hawk.

column1: 13429=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_A18Desc=The tsunami marks the most dangerous time of the year to take to the great seas
column2: with frequent storms and devastating waves ruining many an expedition. Wise captains plan their journeys to avoid the storm season.
its constellation flickering in and out of view throughout the year.

column1: 13433=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_A20Desc=The fiend hides in the darkness of the void
column2: hungry for wayward stars to extinguish.

column1: 13435=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_A21Desc=The bull charges across the night sky with determination and strength.
13437=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_A22Desc=The wraith roams the skies for all eternity
column2: its final judgement by Ulcama never passed.

column1: 13439=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_A23Desc=The harpy represents dark omens. To be born under her light is seen as a sign of shame
column2: driving some families to abandon such children altogether.

column1: 13441=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_A24Desc=The wily fox leaps playfully across the night sky.

column2: its counterpart is the dryad.

column1: 13445=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_A26Desc=The dryad embodies nature's spirit and purity
column2: her counterpart is the ghoul.
seeking its next meal.

column1: 13451=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_A29Desc=The tortoise represents fortitude and unyielding dedication.
13453=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_A30Desc=The panther represents spiritual strength and dexterity.

column2: its counterpart is the vulture.
its counterpart is the crane.

column1: 13459=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_A33Desc=The loyal hound awaits the call of its celestial masters
column2: ever eager to follow the huntress onto another hunt.

column1: 13461=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_A34Desc=The spider weaves its web in the night sky
column2: trapping rogue stars for the gods to weave into their celestial tapestry.

column1: 13463=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_A35Desc=The lizard was one of the first spawn of the celestial Tree of Life
column2: the forefather of all reptiles.

column1: 13465=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_A36Desc=The scholar's light glows brightly when sleep-deprived scholars are still working under the dim glow of their candles.

column2: valor
column3: the birth of kings.

column2: searching for easy pickings.

column1: 13472=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_B01Desc=It is said that when Rhowan of Arkovia abdicated his throne
column2: his crown and scepter were quickly lost
column3: only to be found in the night sky the following day.

column2: the judge
column3: presides over the heavens and judges the lives of all mortals. It is said that all of a person's deeds are placed upon his golden scales
column4: and should the evils of their life outweigh the good
column5: their spirit is forever banished into the void.

column1: 13476=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_B03Desc=The wendigo is a primal hunger spirit. Many shamans go against their very teachings and try to make a pact with wendigos in the hope of invoking the vile spirits upon their enemies; but wendigos are ultimately very perilous to control and have driven many  shamans mad
column2: filling them with an insatiable hunger that inevitably leads to cannibalism.
stalking her celestial prey. It is said that her eternal hunt will end when at last she slays the immortal hydra.

column1: 13480=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_B05Desc=The dire bear is a symbol of pride and physical might. Those born under its light are said to descend from the kings of old.

column2: the celestial executioner is rarely seen in the night sky. Its arrival is often cloaked in thick clouds
column3: from which it emerges for brief moments before disappearing once more into the veil.

column1: 13484=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_B07Desc=The magi is the patron of all practitioners of magic. Those born under his gaze are said to be blessed
column2: or cursed depending on the point of view
column3: with unparalleled control over arcane forces.

column1: 13486=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_B08Desc=The autumn boar's arrival in the sky marks the beginning of a celebration of the fall season and the changing of the leaves. The event begins with a great hunt and ends with a feast that lasts until the meat and beer run dry.
13488=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_B09Desc=The widow mourns for the lost and the dead. When streaks of light mark the night sky
column2: they are said to be the widow's tears.

column1: 13490=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_B10Desc=The revenant represents death and misery. It is said that none can escape its deathly gaze
column2: not even the gods themselves.

column1: 13492=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_B11Desc=Solael is said to be the most cruel of the three witch gods
column2: having carved open countless victims with his curved sacrificial blade in his mad pursuit of immortality.
the witch god
column3: was headed to the gallows when she abandoned her mortal form and ascended into the heavens
column4: her broken chains the only sign of her escape.

column1: 13496=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_B13Desc=The tempest is said to shine brightest when a dangerous storm looms on the horizon. Children born during a thunderstorm are believed marked for great things.
13498=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_B14Desc=Targo is the patron of craftsmen and architects
column2: the god believed to have created the celestial tapestry upon which all stars now rest.

column1: 13500=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_B15Desc=In the winter months this constellation appears on the northern horizon. It is said that travelers in desperation who follow the guiding star of Amatok may come upon his lodge. Those who enter will be allowed to sit at his blazing hearth and share in a bountiful feast but those who are foolish
column2: Amatok will flay and prepare as his feast on the following night.

column1: 13502=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_B16Desc=The appearance of the affliction in the sky
column2: following the great feast of the Autumn Boar
column3: marks the beginning of the cold months
column4: when disease and decay turn Cairn into a bleak contrast to the prosperous months of harvest.

column1: 13504=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_B17Desc=The crab marks the beginning of the most prosperous fishing season of the year
column2: but also one of the most dangerous as the larger spawns of the sea come closer to shore following the migration patterns of the smaller fish and crabs.

column1: 13506=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_B18Desc=The manticore is a vicious predator that roams the night sky in search of its next meal. Its bite and tail are filled with venom.

column2: the watcher
column3: stood guard at Symon's Ward til his dying day
column4: protecting the empire from supernatural threats. Symon's eternal vigil continues in the celestial sky
column5: watching over Cairn as he did in life.

column1: 13510=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_B20Desc=The messenger of war is a symbol of fear and tyranny. The messenger rides across the starry void
column2: heralding in a new age of conflict and strife.

column1: 13512=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_B21Desc=Sea captains are known to refuse voyage if the Kraken is bright in the sky without the light of the Sailor's Guide to protect them.
13514=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_B22Desc=The mythical beast roams the night sky
column2: immortal and imposing. Its many heads are said to regrow within moments.

column1: 13516=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_B23Desc=Nadaan is the guardian of thieves and assassins. The appearance of his blades in the sky is often interpreted as a sign of ill omen; that an evil
column2: but necessary
column3: act is about to be carried out.

column1: 13518=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_B24Desc=It is said that when Rhowan of Arkovia abdicated his throne
column2: his crown and scepter mysteriously disappeared
column3: only to be found in the night sky the following day.

column1: 13520=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_B25Desc=The berserker is the wild and untamed matron of war. She represents strength and ferocity.

column2: is the guardian of mages and sorcerers. It is said that his guiding light serves as a beacon when traversing the veil between reality and the aether.

column1: 13524=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_B27Desc=The shieldmaiden stands guard over the stars
column2: so that none leave their celestial positions without the behest of the gods.
endlessly moving and shifting the countless stars in the sky at their command.

column1: 13528=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_B29Desc=The chariot of the dead gathers wayward souls and delivers them to their final judgement across the veil.
13530=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_B30Desc=Ulo represents the endless cycle and unstoppable flow of water
column2: renewing all the rivers of the world and in turn the lakes and the seas.

column1: 13532=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_B31Desc=The scythe represents bounty and the time of harvests. It shines brightest in the hottest months
column2: before giving way to the Autumn Boar.

column1: 13535=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_C01Desc=Aeon is known as the keeper of time
column2: the master of fate's thread. It is by his judgement that mortals are born and die. His symbol is the hourglass.
the abomination
column3: represents humanity's basest instincts
column4: fear of death and shadows
column5: the desire to have what you have not. The abomination embodies all that turns man wicked.

column2: the greatest among the gods
column3: is the light of the world and protector of all of Cairn. It is by his mercy and example that the sun greets mankind each day.

column2: who would come to be known as the war god. When faced with the destruction of his nation
column3: Oleron made the difficult choice to rise to the defense of his people
column4: but the victory cost him his wife and only child. The loss weighed heavily upon the war hero
column5: and legends say that he would charge recklessly into battle since that day
column6: seeking death upon a foe's blade so that he could be reunited with his family. But the bittersweet release had never come. To this day
column7: when soldiers charge into battle
column8: they call upon Oleron's name to grant them strength and courage.

column2: god of the earth
column3: is a steadfast protector of Cairn. He is prayed to equally both by men eager to defend their home and farmers hoping for a bountiful crop. Ancient stone monoliths mark sacred grounds of Menhir to this day.

column1: 13545=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_C06Desc=The Spear of the Heavens is the celestial symbol of power. It is said that the Spear was wielded by Empyrion himself when he smote down the Dying God and shattered the deity into a thousand-thousand pieces.
13547=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_C07Desc=Ulzuin the Betrayed was once a god of healing and ceremonies
column2: but millennia of torment following a most grisly betrayal from his lover has twisted the once benevolent entity into a bitter deity interested only in vengeance and destruction.

column1: 13549=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_C08Desc=In an age preceding the creation of the mortal planes
column2: an elder god was betrayed by his children; his body torn apart and drained of blood so that they could use its power to breathe life into their own creations. His remains were cast out of creation into a void but
column3: incapable of death
column4: the god lingered on in the darkness
column5: doomed to an eternity of pain and madness; feeling the suffering and death of all mortal things that were given life from his blood. His name forgotten by time
column6: the dying god is known only as Ch'thon; he who dwells below creation.

column1: 13551=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_C09Desc=Legends say that when the world was first born from the darkness of the void
column2: a single tree was planted which would come to bear all the fruit and animals of the world.

column1: 13553=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_C10Desc=A titan created during the war of the gods
column2: Mogdrogen has become the god of beasts and is said to roam the wild reaches of Cairn. Legends claim Mogdrogen is a shapeshifter
column3: usually seen as a giant wolf but occasionally taking other forms
column4: even that of a human. Mogdrogen roams the far reaches of Cairn
column5: guarding the wilds against the encroachment of civilization.

column1: 13555=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_C11Desc=Many would travel thousands of miles to seek out the wisdom of the great blind sage
column2: but most would leave unsatisfied
column3: their souls undeserving of her ageless wisdom.

column2: devourer of stars and deliverer of the cold chill of night.

column1: 13559=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotion_C13Desc=Many a legend are told about the nameless men and women who were felled in battle
column2: their valor and deeds never acknowledged. In honor of their sacrifice
column3: the stars themselves were rearranged to form the Unknown Soldier.

column1: 13562=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotionEffectA01Desc=Vampiric fangs assault your foes and sap them of vitality.
13564=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotionEffectA02Desc=Spines coated with deadly toxin erupt around you.

column2: striking down nearby foes.

column1: 13568=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotionEffectA06Desc=Call upon your minions to join you in battle.
13570=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotionEffectA08Desc=Mark your target for a swift and painful death.
13572=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotionEffectA09Desc=A peerless eye of the Great Guardian circles around you.
13574=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotionEffectA10Desc=A cast of celestial falcons swoops down upon your foes.
13576=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotionEffectA18Desc=A torrent of water crashes down upon any foes unfortunate enough to be standing in front of you.
13578=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotionEffectA19Desc=A small burst of aetherfire erupts at your target's feet.

column2: incinerating all they touch.

column1: 13582=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotionEffectA21Desc=Strike nearby foes in a rush of physical force
column2: like a charging bull.
you are thrown into a ghoulish fervor
column3: desperate for a morsel of flesh.

column1: 13586=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotionEffectA26Desc=The dryad's blessing cleanses your wounds and wards you against poison.

column2: a protective barrier forms around you
column3: negating further harm.

column1: 13591=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotionEffectB01Desc=A crackling whirlwind of flame and ice manifests itself at your command.

column2: sapping your attackers of vitality and transferring it to you.

column1: 13595=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotionEffectB03Desc=You mark your foes with the sign of the wendigo
column2: sapping them of what little there is left of their vitality and transferring it to you.
exposing delicate arteries and inducing intense bleeding.

column1: 13599=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotionEffectB05Desc=Maul nearby foes with the might of a dire bear. ^oRequires a melee weapon.
13601=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotionEffectB06Desc=Push the advantage by unleashing a burst of phantasmal blades that pass through enemies with ease.

column2: spewing lava and brimstone upon nearby foes.

column1: 13606=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotionEffectB08Desc=Unleash a wave of force from your shield that shatters the very earth and scatters your foes.
13608=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotionEffectB09Desc=Mark the ground with an arcane sigil that erupts upon coming in contact with an enemy. ^oArcane Bombs take 1 second to arm.
13612=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotionEffectB10Desc=Raise the dead to serve you. The necrotic energies required for this ritual are very unstable however
column2: and the undead minions will only exist for a limited time. ^oThe dead scale with Pet Bonuses.

column1: 13615=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotionEffectB11Desc=Eldritch flames erupt from your blows and spread wildly among your foes.

13617=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotionEffectB12Desc=Call forth an eldritch hound to snap and tear at your foes. The hound's presence in the physical realm is unstable and it will only remain at your side for a limited time. ^oThe hound scales with Pet Bonuses.

column2: unleashed upon nearby foes in the form of destructive bolts of lightning.

column1: 13625=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotionEffectB15Desc=Shards of razor-sharp ice rain down from the sky upon your foes.
13627=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotionEffectB16Desc=A festering pool erupts beneath your enemies
column2: corrupting the ground.

column1: 13629=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotionEffectB17Desc=A barrier to the forces of magic forms around you.
13631=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotionEffectB18Desc=The manticore's sting pierces through your target
column2: creating a spray of caustic acid behind them.
rebuking any foe daring enough to try and stop you.
incurring improved regeneration and healing.

column1: 13637=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotionEffectB29Desc=Sacrifice a wayward soul to ward yourself against the specter of death.
13639=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotionEffectB30Desc=Ulo's cleansing waters purge all foul magic from the area
column2: removing beneficial auras and spells from foes while allies are cleansed of negative ailments
column3: including damage over time effects.

column1: 13642=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDevotionEffectC01Desc=The sands of the hourglass spin in an untamed whirlwind. The laws of time itself no longer apply to you.

column1: 14442=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuestItemHartsAmulet_Text="To my dear brother: May this amulet keep you strong in battle. -Sybil"
14445=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuestItemCultistKey_Text="The key is marked with many strange runes and depraved symbols characteristic of the cult of Ch'thon."
14447=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuestItemDirections_Text=A deal's a deal: The cultists are sitting cozy up in the mountains
column2: out of the way of the usual travelers. Head out to the broken bridge in the Burrwitch Outskirts. Once there
column3: hug the cliff side until you find a path leading into the hills.{^n}{^n}When you find men in blood-soaked robes beckoning the dark powers
column4: you're in the right place. The entrance to their sanctuary is past the camp
column5: carved into the mountainside.

column2: {^n}{^n}The Aetherial presence in Burrwitch grows stronger with each passing day. We are shifting our operations beyond the city limits where we may proceed with our plans undisturbed. Our focus now turns upon Devil's Crossing
column3: where our newest agent
column4: Direni
column5: has successfully sabotaged their water pump. Soon that irksome group will be forced to flee their sanctuary
column6: and then they shall be at our mercy. Ready yourselves
column7: brothers. Soon we shall drink of their blood!{^n}{^n}Salazar
column8: Blade of Ch'thon"

but otherwise in good condition."

14466=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuestItemSmithHammer_Desc="An ancient forging hammer passed down through generations. It bore witness to the birth of countless artifacts

14481=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuestItemUroboruukInfo_Desc="Notes seemingly abandoned by Master Necromancer Uroboruuk."
14484=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuestItemKymonRelic_Desc="A shriveled eye brimming with arcane energies. You can't help but feel as if it's staring back at you."
14487=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuestItemExileBossDrop_01Desc="This tome appears sealed by arcane forces. The cover refuses to budge."

devout follower of a forgotten god."

column1: 14528=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuestItemHeavyExplosives_Desc="Infused by military sorcerers to guarantee a giant payload."
14531=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuestItemLegionSupplies_Desc="A stash of Black Legion raw materials. A veritable fortune given the situation in the empire."

column2: {^n}I am confident that this letter will find its way to you. You cannot resist returning to this place; I know that the memories of that night still conjure nightmares in your sleep. The face you saw
column3: that is the price one pays for learning the truth. Truth which you deny!{^n}{^n}Do you remember how we used to play around the old ruins as children? Father always told us not to
column4: that we would be swept away by the harpies that fill the sky in the twilight hours. But what if he was not just trying to protect us? Perhaps there were ulterior motives to keeping us away from the old places of the world? What if
column5: should we venture inside
column6: we would learn more about his past than he wished for us to know?{^n}{^n}I have done what you could not
column7: Daila. I have defied our father and entered the depths of Anguish. It is there that my eyes were truly opened. If you are wise
column8: you will do as I have...{^n}{^n}Dravis

column2: {^n}by now you must have seen the haunting echoes from Arkovia's past. Have you never wondered how all this came to be? How Arkovia really fell? Father called it greed
column3: but greed alone cannot condemn a man to such torment. Nay
column4: powerful sorcery was at play here.{^n}{^n}I could feel it in very walls. The stones screamed with unfettered rage
column5: rage towards...me. Do the dead despise the living so? Do they yearn after what was stolen from them? To exist in such a state of endless limbo would drive any soul mad
column6: but I do not believe that madness is what inspired this response. There was something familiar within these stones.{^n}{^n}I have to learn more. So I intend to visit the one place I know our father had been: our childhood home. Of course
column7: this presents me with a bit of a challenge
column8: as you well know why
column9: for our home was consumed by the Chthonian rifts not long ago. But such trivialities will not stop me from discovering the answers I seek...{^n}{^n}Dravis

column2: {^n}The pieces are finally falling into place. The answers were under our very noses all along. The rift violently consumed our home
column3: but in doing so it revealed what was hidden from us underneath the floorboards. Our father kept a journal
column4: a seemingly innocuous object
column5: yet the pages were sealed from me with a protective rune.{^n}{^n}Carelessly
column6: or perhaps arrogantly
column7: I dispelled the seal. The resulting flames consumed the book and marked my face with embers that refuse to extinguish. It is agonizing
column8: but I will endure. Despite our father's efforts
column9: I was able to rescue some pages from the inferno. He told us that our mother died in childbirth
column10: that much is true
column11: but what you do not know is that we were not the first. There were other women
column12: and other children
column13: but the dates...they did not make any sense. It was not until I turned to the final page that the answer became clear.{^n}{^n}I must make haste to the City of the Dead. Therein lies our final clue...{^n}{^n}Dravis

column2: {^n}I shake in anticipation of what is to come
column3: I can hardly write these words with a stable hand. Our father
column4: our legacy
column5: it is more than I could have ever asked for
column6: more than I could have even imagined. To deny us this heritage...it is a crime against his very children. But I have learned his secrets and I will not be denied.{^n}{^n}Our father is immortal
column7: Daila. It has taken him a thousand-thousand souls trapped within a single moment of agony to accomplish this impossible deed. What dark day in history served in the pursuit of immortality
column8: I cannot say. But here
column9: in the Necropolis
column10: our father prepared a different ritual. This one was meant to harvest what remained of the tormented dead within the grave site
column11: to replenish his own shattered being
column12: but for whatever reason he never finished it. The sigil was abandoned. All that remained was to light the pyre and offer a living sacrifice.{^n}{^n}Without hesitation
column13: I finished what he could not. Though I am not truly immortal as he is
column14: the power within these souls will be enough for me to track him down and repay him for all the suffering he has instilled upon us. Then
column16: I shall use the calamity that now consumes the world to do as our father had before
column17: all those centuries ago.{^n}{^n}Should you reconsider in joining me
column19: seek me out to the North. I shall be standing triumphantly over our father's ashes.{^n}{^n}Dravis

column1: 14547=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuestItemShrineMarker_Dreeg_Text="Runestone carried by the thralls of Dreeg. There is an inscription along the edge: Though the Three are now as one
column2: it was not always so. Wary of the other's power
column3: they quarelled across Cairn in destructive displays of Eldritch might. Mountains crumbled and RIVERS shifted
column4: but no god emerged the victor..."

column1: 14550=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuestItemShrineMarker_Bysmiel_Text="Runestone carried by the followers of Bysmiel. There is an inscription along the edge: ...And so
column2: by the light of the EASTERN star
column3: the Three joined together at their Sanctum. Bound by divine blood
column4: their quarrels put to rest. The Covenant of the Three was forged."

column1: 14553=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuestItemShrineMarker_Solael_Text="Runestone carried by the adherents of Solael. There is an inscription along the edge: ...In the end it was Solael who looked past the carnage and saw the inevitability of their actions. In truth
column2: none could triumph where all three were equal. He sent his loyal Attendant to speak before the rest of a resolution. They would seal a pact
column3: there among the SWAMPY remains of their last skirmish."

column1: 14560=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoreObj_InquisitorCreedA01Text=I am currently en route to the village of Burrwitch in order to investigate a number of strange incidents that have been reported in this area. As dusk is drawing near and the swamps of this region are said to be hazardous to travel at night
column2: I've reluctantly taken up lodging at a small squalid tavern in Lower Crossing.{^n}{^n}Perhaps I am weary from my hurried travels but I feel as if there is a strange pressure and electricity to the air. It is almost akin to the still before a thunderous summer gale but yet the sun shines and not a cloud is to be seen.  Everything seems as it should
column3: but in my gut I feel that something terrible will soon come to pass...

column1: 14564=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoreObj_InquisitorCreedA02Text=As I was packing to resume my journey to Burrwitch
column2: my assistance was urgently requested at a logging camp in the Old Grove west of Devil's Crossing
column3: where strange animal attacks have left three lumbermen listless and pale.{^n}{^n}Upon arriving
column4: I received a somber greeting from the foreman who informed me that the bitten workers had gone mad and fled the premises. They were reported to have spoken in an unknown tongue.  The foreman showed me the remains of the animals. Two gray foxes and a hound
column5: suffering some sort of horrific mange
column6: lay in a hastily dug pit behind the outhouse. The foreman told me the animals suddenly died when confronted by the workers and a strange green vapor emanated from their remains. Shortly afterwards
column7: the three lumbermen fell ill and their mental state rapidly deteriorated. It appears that my presence in this region is most warranted.

column1: 14568=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoreObj_InquisitorCreedA03Text=I've finally arrived in Burrwitch after passing through the dismal area known as Wightmire. For years
column2: tales of supernatural occurrences have circulated about Wightmire and indeed the name itself makes one uneasy. I hadn't put much stock in them but my recent experiences lend some credence to the old tales.{^n}{^n}Nevertheless
column3: I have reached my destination and it seems the Warden of Devil's Crossing
column4: who resides in Burrwitch
column5: somehow anticipated my arrival. A footman greeted me as soon as I entered town and insisted I accept Krieg's invitation to be put up at his manor. I find this very peculiar but I have accepted the offer as it may be my best chance to investigate the manor itself.{^n}{^n}Going to make this entry short as I've just been summoned to join Krieg for supper in the dining hall. This should prove...  illuminating.

column1: 14572=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoreObj_InquisitorCreedA04Text=I've been a guest to Warden Krieg at his manor for over a week now and my suspicions that something terrible is going on here grow with each day. Every day
column2: I set out to some destination in or around Burrwitch to investigate yet another unusual crime or ominous rumor. Some are easily dismissed as more mundane human crimes or merely fantastic tales
column3: but many of my investigations have come to darker conclusions. I feel there is a pattern emerging here but I cannot yet put the pieces together.{^n}{^n}These are peripheral cases though and the main purpose of my involvement in them is to give pretense for my prolonged stay in Burrwitch. Krieg himself has become the focus of my primary investigation. Despite an overwhelming conviction that Krieg is not what he appears to be and is almost certainly involved in some sort of unnatural activity
column4: I have found no irrefutable evidence of wrongdoing that could be used to open an official inquisition.{^n}{^n}Much of the manor itself is closed off to me. There are rooms upstairs from which Krieg and other visitors come and go but I am not permitted to enter. Stranger yet
column5: I've awoken in the night to sounds like the creaking of wagons moving along a road but then looked out my window down upon the village and seen nothing. Where are these sounds coming from? The game of cat and mouse continues but
column6: as of yet
column7: I am not certain who is the cat and who is the mouse...

column1: 14576=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoreObj_InquisitorCreedA05Text=Krieg has gotten the better of me and I am presently at his mercy
column2: imprisoned beneath his manor.{^n}{^n}Seeing no other way to progress in my investigation
column3: I forced my way into the locked portion of the manor and found myself in a veritable house of horrors. The unusual sorcery on the locks should have been my first clue that I was dealing with something more extraordinary than some rogue occultist.{^n}{^n}My search led me through a room filled with the rotting bodies of men and women subjected to brutal torture or horrible experimentation
column4: or perhaps some mix of the two. Behind the manor I found a door leading down into the earth beneath the estate
column5: where I found myself quickly lost in an implausibly large dungeon. It wasn't long before I sensed things moving in the darkness all around me and they quickly closed in
column6: surrounding me. As I prepared to fight for all I was worth
column7: Krieg's massive form emerged from the shadows
column8: his face expressionless. He spoke coolly as though nothing at all was out of the ordinary and invited me to tour his facility. While I had no doubt that something unpleasant was planned for me
column9: it at least delayed my confrontation with the living horrors gathering in the dark.

column1: 14580=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoreObj_InquisitorCreedA06Text=I've lingered in this dank cell for one long unsettling day and a night of terrors. Krieg allowed me to witness the process by which they are preserving human bodies for what he calls the Glorious Dawn.{^n}{^n}I have gotten glimmerings of another consciousness within Krieg
column2: which is joined with or possibly in control of him. From the way he spoke
column3: it is clear that this is only some small part of a much greater conspiracy and I suspect many other persons in key positions have been possessed by things akin to that which now inhabits Krieg. I was arrogant in my initial handling of Krieg and seriously misjudged the power and scale of the threat we are faced with.{^n}{^n}Fortunately
column4: Krieg's own arrogance has likewise led him to misjudge the resourcefulness of his prisoner. He has invited me to ascend beyond humanity by pledging myself to his cause or to join his inventory of embalmed corpses. I've been left to contemplate this decision but this cell
column5: even magically warded
column6: cannot hold the likes of me and I have no intention of being here when Krieg returns for my answer.

column1: 14585=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoreObj_InquisitorCreedA07Text=Much time has passed since my last entry. Following my escape from Krieg's laboratory
column2: I have raced against time and lost
column3: passed through darkness and flame
column4: and witnessed the ruin of the world as I knew it.{^n}{^n}Even as I assumed key figures in the capital were likely to be possessed by the entities we now call Aetherials
column5: I reasoned that it was only with support from within capital that we could hope to thwart them. Any action that began outside the capital could be spun as a political rebellion and crushed with the empire's own forces before the truth could be exposed. Thus
column6: I cast the dice and raced toward the heart of Erulan
column7: trying to conceal myself as best I could.{^n}{^n}Upon my arrival
column8: I proceeded cautiously
column9: booking a room at a squalid inn near the west gates in an effort to keep my arrival secret. Initially I sought out old acquaintances
column10: assuming if I could detect some change in personality or behavior
column11: it might reveal possession. A few awkward reunions made it painfully obvious that years on the road carrying out my duties as an inquisitor had left me out of touch and unable to discern whether any changes were the result of possession
column12: or just the passage of time and faded memories. The only gamble left then was to report back to the citadel of the Luminari and see what came of it. I never made it there.{^n}{^n}Waiting until the sunlight dwindled and crowds thinned in the streets below
column13: I rose to leave but was quite startled to see that a shadowy figure had somehow silently breached my room
column14: evading all of the wards set against intruders. This is how I came into cooperation with the First Blade.

column1: 14589=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoreObj_InquisitorCreedA08Text=It was known that anyone of significance who fomented discontent or posed a real threat to the rule of the emperor might be visited by the First Blade. I had never stirred such controversy but I always imagined
column2: if such an encounter took place
column3: I could put up a respectable fight. I never got the chance. Taken unawares
column4: I was disarmed before I even knew what was happening. Had he sought my death
column5: I would not have even witnessed the killing stroke fall. However
column6: he seemed more interested in answers instead and
column7: in turn
column8: provided me with an account of his own events that confirmed my worst fears.{^n}{^n}The First Blade revealed that
column9: only days prior
column10: he had been forced to turn his knives on the Emperor himself
column11: by his own command. Despite the myriad safeguards protecting the Emperor
column12: both mundane and arcane
column13: he had become host to an Aetherial. Through strength of mind
column14: he had usurped his possessor long enough to summon the First Blade
column15: command his own execution and charge the assassin with ensuring that his son
column17: survive to reclaim the throne.{^n}{^n}His last commands issued
column18: the Emperor's consciousness slipped once again under the control of the Aetherial and a desperate battle ensued. The First Blade reported that he believed the Emperor and the Aetherial within him slain but
column19: given his inexperience with the entities
column20: could not say anything for certain. He relayed that he had secretly taken the prince and put him into hiding but declined to elaborate. The First Blade said he intended to retire his imperial title and had chosen the name Ulgrim
column21: which made me curious as to whether it was an intentional reference to the mythic character.{^n}{^n}A final troubling detail was that no proclamation of the Emperor's passing had been issued. Not only did this demonstrate the Aetherials had sufficient control of the palace to conceal the death but
column22: given that they couldn't hope to hide the Emperor's absence for long
column23: it suggested the next phase of their operation was imminent.{^n}{^n}I strategized with Ulgrim long into the night
column24: formulating a plan to counter the Aetherials
column25: but ultimately we agreed that we could not defeat their conspiracy in time. The only course left was gather whatever people and resources we could
column26: go to ground and weather the coming storm; then find a way to counter the invaders.{^n}{^n}We agreed that the Black Legion would be our best hope in securing allies. As a conscripted army of criminals
column27: debtors and political dissidents bound to service
column28: it seemed unlikely that the Aetherials would have any reason to infiltrate them when they could control them indirectly through the military high command. The next step was to discretely make contact.

column2: I ain't a decent man and I sure ain't good at writing
column3: but word needs to get out 'bout what this place really is. This prison
column4: it ain't like no joint I ever been in
column5: and I've seen double my share. Men don't stay here long neither and some of the lads they haul in
column6: they ain't criminals. I'd know. Moment I see a man
column7: I can tell by his eyes that he done wrong. These boys? I see fear.{^n}{^n}I seen this warden a coupla times
column8: big man in black armor. If you ain't know better
column9: you'd think he was on the wrong side of the bars. Every day
column10: he and his lackeys take prisoners out to this hut in the yard by the dozen. They ain't never come out. Later
column11: a wagon rolls in by the hut. It always leaves full.{^n}{^n}They don't let us outa our cells no more
column12: but I can tell there ain't much of us left. The halls are quiet. I'm the last man in my row. The others? They was taken in yesterday's batch. I ain't asking for pity. I know my end's in that hut; but perhaps this note will be my one good deed in my pathetic life...

column1: 14597=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoreObj_LowerCrossingA01Text=Autumn fogs are appearing early this year but traffic remains unusually high.  There is a steady flow of small craft coming down from Malmouth and other townships to the Nor'East. Some of these boats are barely afloat burdened with what looks like people's every possession. These travelers
column2: sometimes entire families
column3: bring with them strange tales of wars and the unnatural. Bunch'a hogwash riling up the soft townsfolk. Can't complain tho'
column4: keeps the dock busy. Most are Westbound
column5: trying to get as far away as they can.{^n}{^n}The lads at the docks are starting to lose their nerve. Some have talked about setting out West themselves but I've assured them this is all nonsense and will pass. Youth are easily caught up in the energy of the moment.

column1: 14601=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoreObj_BurrwitchB01Text=Another boat arrived filled with hooded prisoners
column2: dozens of 'em. As usual
column3: a wagon was waiting for them but from what I hear
column4: it doesn't take 'em far. One of the loading boys came back from Burrwitch after visiting that there new doctor and he said the wagon stopped outside the Warden's mansion. The lad asked 'bout the prisoners and one of the handlers said "rehabilitation". Not sure what to make of that.{^n}{^n}There's been o'er a dozen of these prisoner transports in as many weeks. I just don't see how they can fit 'em all in that mansion. I don't care how big that place may be
column5: Krieg won't be keeping a prison's worth of no good thieves under his roof. Somethin' peculiar is going on there and it don't settle right in my stomach. Might have to send word up the lake to Malmouth
column6: get one of them inquisitors down here to look into this curiosity. Can't say I want one o'them inquisitors poking around here much either though. They make a man uneasy.

column2: I will die in this house.  Margaret
column3: I fear that you are already dead and so it may not be so bad if I am shortly to join you.  If by some miracle
column4: you yet live and return here to find this note
column5: please know that I am not angry with you. I've never regretted our life together but now only regret that I lost my temper and spoke unkind words when last we parted.{^n}{^n}I hope you will not think me a coward for what I am about to do. They are already in the house. I've barricaded myself in this room but it is only a matter of time before they break through.  All I can do now is choose the manner in which I face death and I would rather die a man than be changed into one of those horrid things or eaten alive.  I will love you always...{^n}{^n}Francis

column1: 14609=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoreObj_WightmireA01Text=The time has come to strike at our Aetherial nemesis in Wightmire. Even now
column2: we gather our forces in the hills above Burrwitch for an assault on the Village. However
column3: before that can happen
column4: we must first secure Wightmire so that there are no enemies at our backs.{^n}{^n}Though strong
column5: loyal and ready to die in the name of Ch'thon
column6: I believe you have insufficient Bloodbound to overcome the Aetherial presence. We have had great success recently in bringing forth more powerful servants of Ch'thon from the Void. A single Harbinger could wipe out all of the Aetherials in Wightmire and even take on Devil's Crossing
column7: which could serve as a stronghold for our order in this region.{^n}{^n}To bring forth a Harbinger
column8: you will need the blood and lives of at least three men. Gather the sacrifices however you see fit; either from refugees on the road
column9: rover camps or chosen amongst your own Bloodbound. Inform me of your success when it is complete.{^n}{^n}Ulto Treig
column10: Grand Priest

column1: 14613=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoreObj_WightmireA02Text=I'm afraid I may have to break a promise. I'm not about to give up yet but things aren't looking good outside. I was lucky to survive that first night when I volunteered to distract the rotten walkers while Bourbon and his group
column2: including my little sister Sybil
column3: made their way through to Devil's Crossing. I believe in Bourbon and if anyone can get those people through
column4: it's him. Before they left
column5: I looked Bourbon in the eye and told him to keep her safe. He put his arm on my shoulder and spoke in that calm reassuring tone of his. He told me that he would do everything he can
column6: but I had to promise him something too: that I would do my damn best to get out of this alive.{^n}{^n}Well I've sure got myself into a fine fix. I diverted them walkers alright but now I'm all hemmed in. I've been hiding in a group of old dilapidated shacks and keep changing position whenever the dead get too close. I can't find a way forward though and I'm running out of daylight. The walkers seem stupid generally but I think they dug out the riverbanks last night
column7: allowing the water to wash the road out. It's almost as though something is directing them.{^n}{^n}I'm not done yet and have no intention of dying in this rotting shack. I'm going to try to break free and will go out fighting if I have to. If the worst comes to pass and you're finding this note on my cold corpse
column8: well
column9: please let my sister Sybil know what's come to pass and tell her to be brave. I can only hope she made it to Devil's Crossing.

column1: 14617=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoreObj_WightmireA03Text=Got ourselves a bunch of them idiot Rovers wandering in our hideout the other night. They were unarmed
column2: as they often are. Course
column3: they tried to run when we jumped them
column4: but little good that did them. Now we have ourselves a few slaves digging in the mine. We can't eat coal though
column5: and our food supplies are starting to run out. The Rovers barely had a few scraps between them.{^n}{^n}With the Burrwitch bridge destroyed
column6: we're stuck in this swamp. I'm beginning to wonder if perhaps we made a mistake by not following Cronley's Gang to the west. May not be much pickings in the wilderness on that side of Devil's Crossing
column7: but at least they had numbers. Could probably hunt down a decent-sized boar between the lot of them. Out here? We got nothing but slith and the dead.

column1: 14621=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoreObj_WardensJournalA01Text=I have taken possession of my assigned vessel
column2: the local prison warden. I appeared to him in his bed chamber and proposed the joining. I had anticipated fear and skepticism but these humans are apparently all too ready to enter into any pact they believe will profit them. Krieg is not a particularly strong willed human but he is persistent and constantly scratches at my consciousness. I have him under control though.{^n}{^n}Krieg's position as an incarcerator of other humans will greatly facilitate our efforts. His expansive dwelling has a massive cellar that I believe we can use to fashion an underground transit to conceal our activities and the transport of bodies. There is much work ahead to prepare for our Glorious Dawn but I rather enjoy this physical body. It has many advantages.

column1: 14625=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoreObj_WardensLabA01Text=It is unclear why the Aetherials are so interested in tissue preservation. One of my colleagues has posited that they may intend to use human corpses as vessels for possession when they bring more of their kind into our realm.{^n}{^n}Wagon loads of corpses continue to stream in day and night. The sheer quantity is staggering and I begin to suspect that they are not merely executed criminals as we've been told.

14629=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoreObj_WardensLabA02Text=We entered stage two of our trials today but the results were not what I had anticipated.  We've progressed to the point where the corpses can endure for months
column2: possibly years
column3: with minimal
column4: mostly external
column5: deterioration. Our Aetherial overseer seemed satisfied and he
column6: or it
column7: unexpectedly placed his hand upon one of the corpses and released a spark of aetherial energy. The thing began to move as if it were alive again. It was a ghastly sight.{^n}{^n}What I found far more troubling though is that these corpses are clearly not meant to serve as Aetherial hosts. It has become known to me that they prefer living hosts. The sheer number of corpses they are hauling through here suggests a far worse realization: an army.

column1: 14633=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoreObj_WardensLabA03Text=This will be my last entry as I have determined to end my life. I cannot bring myself to carry out these abominable experiments any longer. I may have already doomed humanity with my actions. Though I have long felt shunned by my fellows at the academy and thought the Aetherials could offer me something greater
column2: I can no longer be a part of this. I fear that if they find my body
column3: they will use me for their experimentations
column4: so I must be discreet. Returning as one of those...things would be unbearable.

column1: 14637=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoreObj_WardensLabB01Text=My colleague Gethrand took his life today - that shortsighted fool. He could never see the big picture and this project was no different. Gethrand could not fathom the glorious vision of the Aetherials and the role we will play as early human collaborators. This isn't about personal gain. We will elevate humanity! Certainly there has been a cost in lives but progress always has a price. So what of the dirty masses who will perish in the Glorious Dawn when the Aetherials reveal themselves to the world. To the Aetherials we are like some base primitive creature
column2: as the Slith are to us. Those of us who will serve
column3: or better yet
column4: bond with an Aetherial
column5: shall forge a new human future.

column2: {^n}{^n}Excuse this crude form of communication. I am far to the North and it seems my thoughts are unable to reach you. In all future material correspondence we will use our host names and common human language forms.{^n}{^n}I write looking for clarification of recent perplexing reports on your conduct.  Is it true that you have been incarcerating and tormenting humans?  What is the purpose for this?  It would seem that your host's predilections are affecting your own behavior. You must bring this under your control and cease this superfluous activity.  Your role is to facilitate our laboratories with the collection of corpses. Limit yourself to the parameters of this task or you will be recalled.

column1: 14645=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoreObj_VillagerNoteB01Text=1st entry{^n}Momma told me to write in this thing
column2: so I suppose now is as good as ever
column3: seeing as I'm grounded
column4: again! So I pulled Abigail's hair. She started it! Why doesn't she have to sit in her room and write in her stupid diary?{^n}{^n}Tomorrow
column5: I'll catch the biggest frog I can find in the marshes and leave it in sister's room. We'll see how she likes that.{^n}{^n}2nd entry{^n}So Momma's been reading my diary and now I'm grounded again. The frog got out before sister even saw it! Why isn't Poppa home yet? He was supposed to take me out to Burrwitch today and he's still not back from business.{^n}{^n}Alister's Diary - 3rd entry{^n}Momma's saying that I'm not allowed to play outside anymore. Perkins said that there are monsters roaming the marshes
column6: but Momma said there is no such thing and she whooped me with the ladle for talking rumors again. I wish Poppa would come home already. I want to go to Burrwitch!{^n}{^n}Alister's Diary - 4th entry{^n}I'm scared. I'm really really scared. Momma locked me and sister in my room while she checked out some noises behind the house. It's been forever and now I hear noises inside the house too. Poppa
column7: please come home and make the noises go away. I don't care about Burrwitch anymore. Just please come home
column8: Poppa.

column1: 14649=//records/davtxt.tekst=TagLoreObj_VillagerNoteH01Text=Town is falling apart around me. Those things are everywhere. God knows what's making them rise. Half of Burrwitch is in flames and still they continue to multiply. No sense trying to stick this out so I'm packing some basics and leaving immediately. I hear the north is all but overrun so I'll try my luck in the south
column2: through Wightmire.{^n}{^n}Horace
column3: if you are reading this note
column4: I'll make camp at Devil's Crossing. Last place I'd want to end up on a good day
column5: but the prison sounds safer than being out in the wild with those things about. Meet me there
column6: if you're still alive.

column1: 14653=//records/davtxt.tekst=TagLoreObj_VillagerNoteJ01Text=Third bunch of bandits this month. You would think that with all that's happened recently people would be a bit more willing to help out one another. But no
column2: seems the world is still teeming with scum who would take advantage of a bad situation.{^n}{^n}If you are a friend of these dirt-bags
column3: follow me and die. There is still room on my belt for a few more notches. If perhaps you are just another lost soul wandering these ruins
column4: don't look for friends out here. People out here are just as likely to slit your throat for a few bullets as to point you in a safe direction. I'm not going to hesitate to fire the first shot
column5: and neither should you.

column1: 14657=//records/davtxt.tekst=TagLoreObj_VillagerNoteK01Text=I pray one of us makes it through this nightmare to deliver the report. The lives of those hiding in Devil's Crossing may depend on it.{^n}{^n}As instructed
column2: my team has braved the wilderness of Wightmire and made it to the outskirts of Burrwitch. The situation there is worse than we feared. We encountered no survivors. The Aetherial takeover of the region is now complete.{^n}{^n}What we found baffling
column3: however
column4: is the heavy concentration of enemy activity within Burrwitch itself. In our previous encounters with the Aetherials
column5: they seemed unfocused
column6: spread out across the wilderness in no predictable pattern; but this seems almost deliberate
column7: as if they were swayed to keep watch over something important.{^n}{^n}I regret to report that
column8: without a larger force at our disposal
column9: even breaching the city walls would incur heavy casualties and thin our already struggling ranks. While I understand completely that our situation is dire and we are desperate for a new source of supplies and food
column10: I cannot recommend a direct engagement with enemy force at Burrwitch. It is a suicide mission.{^n}{^n}We need to be prepared for the eventuality that the enemy gathered at Burrwitch will mobilize upon Devil's Crossing. Should it come to that
column11: we must be prepared to flee once more.{^n}{^n}-Scout Thalna

column1: 14661=//records/davtxt.tekst=TagLoreObj_Kymon01Text=They mocked us and drove us out. They called us heretics and madmen. They thought our great prophecy and purpose was fanciful and ridiculous.{^n}{^n}Woe unto them! Behold the divine wrath that has been delivered onto the unbelievers in the remaking of the world! Our prophecy has come to pass and I hear not laughter anymore. I hear only deathly silence!{^n}{^n}Doom has befallen the wicked
column2: the ignorant and the indolent. Only we chosen few
column3: who have trained and prepared our bodies and our souls to weather the cleansing of the world will survive and thrive amongst this death and decay.{^n}{^n}Look to your right and to your left
column4: in front and behind you. You see the faces of your hallowed brothers and sisters
column5: bonded together in this holy quest. We have been tasked with the sacred duty to extinguish the last remnants of corruption and reseed the purified land with our progeny so that the new dawn can arise! Take strength in each other and in the knowledge that we are destined to fulfill this divine purpose.{^n}{^n}Long have we prepared for this moment and our time of concealment is ending. We will strike forth
column6: boldly Northward and to our destiny. Let not the faithless
column7: the corrupted or the demonic stand in our path
column8: lest our divine wrath be visited upon them! Now muster my children
column9: gather only those belongings that can profit us in our holy war and let us march forth from this humble refuge unto destiny!

column2: dark columns of smoke billow up from the port where the madness long pullulating in the restive populace has finally boiled over. A blazing merchant's galley
column3: abandoned by its crew and freed of its moorings plows into a group of fishing boats
column4: wood splintering
column5: the fire quickly spreading among the sails. I hear shouting in the courtyard below and the clash of iron not far beyond; a woman screams repeatedly
column6: her words indiscernible.{^n}{^n}For so long
column7: we feared our doom would come from the barbarous mountain tribes but in the end
column8: we've been the instruments of our own demise; helped along by the insidious promises of the necromancers.{^n}{^n}It is not yet two moons since the great rituals were undertaken
column9: led by our ever reaching Oligarchs; the rituals intended to bring immortality and ensure the lasting greatness of Arkovia. Ever the skeptic
column10: I figured it for a sham; political theatre at best
column11: but the ritual seems to have been a tragic success.{^n}{^n}This ritual was the invention of a necromancer named Uroboruuk. A man imprisoned in the Steps of Torment
column12: who it is said did not age and could not be killed by any means. The leaders of the three greatest houses
column15: made an ill-conceived journey to the tower in hopes of compelling this Uroboruuk to give up his secrets. Here
column16: immortality worked against Uroboruuk as he was subjected to the most brutal and imaginative forms of torture that could be devised for a man who could not die. Finally
column17: Uroboruuk agreed to instruct them in the ritual and the Oligarchs
column18: blinded by their lust for immortality
column19: were all too eager to believe his will broken and accepted the ritual as genuine.{^n}{^n}It has become clear that the people of Arkovia have indeed gained a form of immortality but it is a cruel and twisted fulfillment of that promise. Our bodies still suffer the ravages of time
column21: whilst our spirits remain trapped within
column22: eternally bound to this land.{^n}{^n}I have witnessed this myself as the sick and elderly
column23: near death at the time of the ritual
column24: remain with us yet. Their bodies visibly decay
column25: in the manner of a corpse
column26: yet they continue on as though living
column27: able to move and talk; still much the same persons as they were in life
column28: yet not.{^n}{^n}All who suffer this death of the body become somehow less vital
column29: less dynamic of thought. They become ever more narrowly focused on whatever concerned them most in life. It is disturbing to witness families that do not know what to do with their deceased
column31: loved ones.{^n}{^n}More horrible still are the rumors of babies born since the ritual. Abominations they say
column32: deformed and bearing dark grisly feathers. It is said that many forlorn new fathers have been seen trekking into the broken hills
column34: to leave their unnatural offspring to the elements.{^n}{^n}The din of fighting and wailing continues on below. I expect it shall for quite some time since the combatants cannot die by any mortal means. I will sit with my books and continue my writing for whatever time may remain... perhaps all eternity...{^n}{^n}Theodokus Vagra

column1: 14669=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoreObj_FloodedPassageRuins01Text=The end of days is upon us! Glorious Arkovia
column2: beacon of the west
column3: is crumbling from within. But fear not
column4: brothers and sisters
column5: for we are the chosen of Ishtak.{^n}{^n}Here
column6: upon the sacred ground of our forefathers
column7: we shall be safe from the ruin brought about by the hubris of the oligarchs. Here
column8: we shall outlast the immortal plague and return to the surface as the second dawn of man.{^n}{^n}It is with a heavy heart that I seal the entrance to our temple. May Ishtak have mercy on the damned souls beyond these walls. They will find no solace here.

column1: 14673=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoreObj_FloodedPassageRuins02Text=The blessings of Ishtak have failed us. The wards did not protect us.  The curse of Arkovia had found its way here.{^n}{^n}We are dying
column2: yet we cannot die. My brothers and sisters tear at each other in their growing madness
column3: only to rise again and renew the carnage once more.{^n}{^n}The gods have abandoned us. This wasn't to be our salvation. This was to be our tomb...

column1: 14677=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoreObj_StepsOfTorment01Text=The one they call Uroboruuk makes mockery of the gods. The Lord Executioner cut at his flesh
column2: but the wounds refused to bleed. His limbs grow back; his skin is impervious to flame.{^n}{^n}I believe the time has come for me to descend into that vile place and deal with the heathen myself. We shall see how he reacts to the cleansing flame of the divine.

column1: 14681=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoreObject_BozemanFollyText=They all say I'm insane for taking the caravan through the deep road. The only thing that's insane is paying bribes to those smug bastards in control of Smuggler's Pass. May as well pay the imperial tariffs!{^n}{^n}I've heard on good account that the dangers in the mountain deeps are well overblown
column2: and that the exit will spit us out far closer to Homestead than that bandit-ridden pass.{^n}{^n}When I'm swimming in gold up to my neck down in Burrwitch
column3: then they'll all see. They'll all see that Bozeman was right.

column2: my brothers. Fear ye the Chthonian
column3: for it is the harbinger of our sins. Speak not the name of its master
column4: for it is the manifestation of malevolence and vile intent. Abhor the heretic
column5: for his words are poison to the ears of the faithful. Just as evil must be purged of the soul
column6: so the heretic must be purged of the living.

column2: my brothers. Blood is the essence
column3: for it gives us life. Drink not of the blood of demons
column4: for it is corruption manifest. Those that partake of blood shall forever be damned. Abhor the gifts of the Chthonian
column5: lest its touch contaminate your soul. Purity of blood heralds the purity of the soul.

column2: my brothers. Let your faith shield you
column3: for it is to the Chthonian as salt upon a festering wound. Guard your faith
column4: for it defines you. Abhor the writing of the heretic
column5: for his texts speak of lies and deceit. The strong of faith will be sung as heroes. The weak shall forever be forgotten.

column2: my brothers. Justice shall be swift and merciless
column3: for it was tempered with faith
column4: blood and fear. Justice shall descend upon the heretic
column5: unforgiving and relentless. Those that take up arms against the Chthonian shall become the fiery vengeance of divine retribution. Those that call the Chthonian god shall taste righteous flame. Justice be done.

column1: 14703=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoreObj_CriminalA01Text=Leander "Blackwater" Greene{^n}{^n}Ex-military man wanted for extortion and murder. Leander was dishonorably discharged from the demolitions division following a grisly civilian incident. Leander escaped custody on at least two separate occasions using unsanctioned explosive devices. {^n}{^n}News of sightings or proof of death should be brought before Warden Krieg of Burrwitch Prison. A reward of 1000 royal crowns is offered for the successful capture and delivery of Leander Greene alive.
14707=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoreObj_CriminalA02Text=Bloody Jack{^n}{^n}Reckless murderer and known worshipper of Solael
column2: the heathen god. Reports have been received of Bloody Jack's signature murders
column3: a carved throat and witch symbols etched into the left breast
column4: appearing increasingly close to Burrwitch. Citizens are advised to avoid traveling alone and to steer clear of forest roads whenever possible.{^n}{^n}News of sightings or proof of death should be brought before Warden Krieg of Burrwitch Prison. A reward of 400 royal crowns is offered for the successful capture and delivery of Bloody Jack alive.

column1: 14711=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoreObj_CriminalA03Text=Everett the Bloodbound {^n}{^n}A Heathen and blood drinker. Known associate of Chthonic cults and supplier for the heretics. When confronted by the law
column2: Everett unleashed a fury of arcane atrocities upon the enforcers and escaped. Extremely dangerous individual. Personnel not trained to deal with the heathen arts are advised to steer clear.{^n}{^n}News of sightings or proof of death should be brought before Warden Krieg of Burrwitch Prison. A reward of 1200 royal crowns is offered for the successful capture and delivery of Everett the Bloodbound alive.

column1: 14715=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoreObj_BookC01Text=To understand the flows of the Aether
column2: one must first learn to appreciate its inherent risks. The arcane art is not a plaything
column3: nor is it a tool meant to be abused. Countless young arcanists have lost their lives to carelessness and malpractice. Proper control of the Aether requires years of practice under the careful supervision of the Gildam Arcanum
column4: the only formal office sanctioned to instruct and research the art of the arcane. Do not confuse what is lectured here with the teachings of the hypothetical witch gods
column5: a common misconception amongst the uneducated. There are no gods. There is only reality and the science of the arcane.

column1: 14719=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoreObj_BookC02Text=To reinforce the ingenuity of arcanists both living and dead
column2: we turn to the works of Master Maiven
column3: a prolific arcanist from the third age of our glorious empire. Master Maiven was able to bend the inherently destructive flows of the Aether to her will in order to manifest a protective barrier around herself. This technique is a stellar example of how the Gildam Arcanum continually strives to break our preconceptions of the Aether
column4: creating entirely new schools of thought within the arcane arts.

column1: 14723=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoreObj_BookD01Text=In all the history of our great nation
column2: there has been no greater atrocity committed than the creation of the vile vermin we call Slith. Part man
column3: part serpent
column4: the Slith were a testament to the dangers of the arcane and served as the driving force behind the formation of the Gildam Arcanum and its tighter sanctions on arcane practices.{^n}{^n}The Slith owe their existence to the actions of a single individual: Oswald Hargate. Backed by family wealth and a passion for research
column5: Oswald aspired to leave his mark upon the study of the arcane. Little did he know that his legacy would leave a permanent stain upon all Arcanists and their field.

column1: 14727=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoreObj_BookD02Text=Oswald Hargate firmly believed that the Aether could be used to create new life. Convinced that he could supersede the gods
column2: Oswald set out to perform his heinous research in a
column3: to this day
column4: unknown location.{^n}{^n}Though not much is known about the exact details of his research
column5: the results were quite clear. Calling his creation a Slith
column6: for its slithering movement and snake-like lower body
column7: Oswald triumphantly announced his findings to the Arcanum Society. The abomination bore the torso of a man and the tail of a snake
column8: though its reptilian snout was unlike either species. Its eyes stared back at you with a hint of human sorrow
column9: though it was clearly a dulled mind with no indication of a human conscience trapped within the slith body.{^n}{^n}Those attending were shocked by the blatant disregard for the gods and their domain. Following a brief trial
column10: Oswald was charged with endangering society and was imprisoned for the remainder of his life. The specimen was destroyed and its ashes scattered to the winds. With Oswald behind bars and the slith dead
column11: all believed that the nightmare was over; but they were wrong.

column1: 14731=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoreObj_BookD03Text=When the first slith began to appear in the area known as Wightmire
column2: it became clear that Oswald did not create just one slith. As his laboratory was never uncovered
column3: officials could only guess as to the origin of the new species. The slith were incredibly invasive
column4: easily dominating the local food chain and reproducing at an alarming rate.{^n}{^n}As their numbers multiplied
column5: the slith adapted a primitive tribal hierarchy
column6: with certain members of their packs exhibiting clear authority over the rest. And
column7: perhaps most alarmingly of all
column8: shamanistic behavior was reported among the slith population
column9: indicating a strong connection to the Aether and perhaps their unnatural origins.{^n}{^n}All efforts to exterminate the slith proved fruitless
column10: with the species simply returning at a new location from hidden nests and caverns. It is without a doubt that the actions of one arrogant individual will continue to reverberate across countless generations to come.

column1: 14735=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoreObj_BookD04Text=First day at my new lab. I must say
column2: I am thrilled to get started. The days of having my nose stuck in the books are over. There comes a time when studying old tomes reaches its limit. Eventually
column3: one must set out on their own to pursue new ventures and ideas not yet considered. It is our sacred duty as scholars to leave a mark upon the world!{^n}{^n}My wife
column4: Helen
column5: and my dearest daughter Ellena will be joining me soon at our new home. Helen has expressed concern about our little girl growing up in a laboratory
column6: so far away from other children
column7: but I've calmed her down. Ellena will have everything she requires
column8: and Burrwitch is just a short boat ride away should she ask for a playmate.{^n}{^n}Together
column9: Helen and I are going to do something no Arcanist has dared even consider: the creation of new life. The Aether is a wondrous source of energy
column10: and yet nobody's stopped to ponder its effects upon organic material. Helen's expertise in the biological arts should prove most valuable in this endeavor.

column2: I have chosen the lowly green swamp adder as the basis of my experiment. Its short lifespan and rapidly shedding skin made for a malleable test subject. The initial results seemed promising at first. Using high concentrations of Aether energy
column3: we were able to instill various mutations within the specimens
column4: creating new limbs or inducing gigantism. Unfortunately
column5: none of the samples survived beyond a couple weeks
column6: their higher brain functions being seemingly incapable of handling the introduction of additional bodily elements.{^n}{^n}For our second batch of experiments
column7: we molded the adders with a few grobles captured by local trappers. The results were...curious to say the least. While this was not the breakthrough I was looking for
column8: we seem to be heading in the right direction. The dull mind of a groble was capable of adapting to its new body
column9: but its primitive and disgustingly malformed physique would see me become the laughing stock of my colleagues. No
column10: I must see this through to its logical conclusion. Helen may frown upon it
column11: but the next step seems clear as day to me...

column1: 14743=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoreObj_BookD06Text=I have sent Helen and Ellena away for the summer to visit family in the capital while I continue my work alone. I tasked a few unsavory individuals to gather "volunteers" for the next stage of my research
column2: mere vagrants and Rovers
column3: people nobody would miss. The fees they charged were considerable
column4: but I will pay any price when I am so close to my breakthrough.{^n}{^n}The samples arrived in the middle of the night
column5: delivered to their cells as promised. My collaborators took their pay and left promptly without asking any questions. Frankly
column6: they looked a bit disturbed. But I was unfazed. They are but simpletons
column7: unable to fathom the importance of my work.{^n}{^n}The specimens began stirring by morning
column8: their frightened cries echoing throughout the lab. I explained to them that they were selected for an important duty
column9: that their lives would finally have meaning and purpose. The scum should have been thanking me
column10: but instead they cursed me as a madman and criminal. I dismissed their accusations and got to work. There was much to be done.

column1: 14747=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoreObj_BookD07Text=Helen and Ellena returned early from their trip. While Ellena was otherwise occupied with her toys in the living quarters
column2: Helen came down into the lab to find me in the midst of my latest study. The horrified look on her face is something I shall never forget. I tried to be reasonable. I explained that what she witnessed was merely a stepping stone
column3: that those men and women died so that our work would not be squandered on snakes and grobles. But she would not budge.{^n}{^n}My wife
column4: my partner
column5: had betrayed me at this most critical junction. My work is too important to let emotional attachments get in the way. I did the only sensible thing. Let history judge my actions...{^n}{^n} With the unfortunate distraction dealt with
column6: I returned to my results. The human-snake hybrids had proven unstable and violent. I was assaulted on several occasions while attempting to study their physical functions
column7: but those attacks proved to be little more than outbursts on the verge of death. All of the specimens died shortly after the procedure. Dissection revealed an incomplete hybridization of internal organs. With a dysfunctional digestive system
column8: death was inevitable. But I wonder if perhaps the subjects were too old for the procedure to succeed. If I started over
column9: with a younger candidate
column10: then perhaps I would finally have the results I seek...
