column12: I cannot say with certainty what is going on
column13: but my gut tells me that there is more at play here than at first appears.{^n}{^n}Captain Frederick Bachknell

column2: as you commanded. It is ironic that the commander of this garrison is one of the weakest minds I have ever encountered. There is so much turmoil and fear that resides within him
column3: he was easy to manipulate and overwhelm. While I do have full control of his body
column4: there is something in the region that tampers with direct communication
column5: something tainted and ancient. Anything capable of such an act demands further investigation. I write this correspondence in the meantime
column6: so that another may look into this matter.{^n}{^n}Fort Ikon has proven to be a challenge for us
column7: and now I understand why. The vast stores of weapons and warmachines the humans have amassed is staggering. It is a wonder that they have not exterminated themselves in their endless pursuit of warfare and self-destruction. Nevertheless
column8: everything moves according to our grand plans. I have already taken steps to sabotage their armory and planted evidence leading to several deserters. Nobody suspects my involvement.{^n}{^n}But the main reason I have deemed it necessary to report to you comes from a most unexpected discovery. The anomaly
column9: the revealer of secrets
column10: walks among these humans and even now shares with them our plans. We have since adjusted our projections in this region
column11: ensuring that anything the anomaly reveals is of no use to the humans
column12: but its knowledge of our ways could still prove detrimental to our success on this world. For now
column13: I have begun sowing the seeds of distrust about the anomaly to the humans
column14: their fear is so great that they had it moved to the prison
column15: where it remains. Once my sabotage is complete and the gates are open
column16: Fort Ikon will fall. Then we can deal with the traitor as is fitting of such unprecedented betrayal.

column1: 14966=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoreObj_AreaDCultist_NoteA01Text=The blood I am hauling is pulled like water from an upturned cup. It presses and climbs up the side of the glass
column2: trying to return to its source. If the lids were not on so tight would they burst off? Would the blood fall sidelong though the air to He who calls it back to Him?{^n}{^n}I confess the urge to release one of the lids is strong. But my conviction is stronger. This is a test and I will pass through fire and into the realm of the gods and legend. Soon the centuries of long sleep will be over. And when the Loghorrean wakes the unbelievers will suffer for their lack of faith.{^n}{^n}Cabalist Zakul

column1: 14969=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoreObj_AreaDCultist_NoteA02Text=Something has changed. Something in the air feels different. It feels like being inside of a bottle when the cork has popped
column2: all the pressure released and my soul pulled from my body to the opening in an explosive release. My mind reels and I find it hard to stay on my feet.{^n}{^n}I can feel it. Deep beneath the ground
column3: they have finally completed the final rites and the door has opened. The blood surges inside me. Pushing. Pulling. Drawing me closer. I must go. I must see the great awakening. If I am chosen
column4: I am ready to be whole once more
column5: to be one with Ch'thon.{^n}{^n}Cabalist Zakul

column1: 14972=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoreObj_AreaDCultist_NoteA03Text=With all the evil unleashed in this world
column2: joining with the Bloodsworn made so much sense at the time. At first it was to escape the horrors unleashed by the Aetherials
column3: the death of my family
column4: my wife
column5: my son. But then later I started to understand and believe the words the cult leaders were telling me. The sense of belonging made me feel important. That I was a part of something greater than myself.{^n}{^n}Now that I stand in the halls of this mighty place
column6: I feel the eyes of all those that gave up their lives: the Leaders
column7: the great heroes and the countless thousands who followed them. They fought so that we could live without fear of the nameless fiends which I now serve. I can feel the honor and sacrifice of my ancestors and I am ashamed. Ashamed because of the terrors I have left in my path.{^n}{^n}For months I have done the most vile and unspeakable things. The deaths of husbands
column8: wives and children are on my bloody hands for no other reason than to serve my own selfishness
column9: to wash me clean of my own fears and the devastating loss that drove me to this madness. Death and murder
column10: all in the name of some long dead god who has no more right to the blood in my veins than I do. Blood that belongs to those who I have killed in its name.{^n}{^n}The blood soaked foundation of this forgotten battleground have peeled away the fear and awoken me. There is no forgiving what I have done
column11: no punishment that will ever make it right. But I can give my last breath
column12: my last drop of blood and at last my life to cause as much damage as I can. I do not stand alone. The great heroes stand with me and I do not fear.

column1: 14975=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoreObj_AreaDCultist_NoteA04Text=At last we stand before the blood soaked gates of victory. The Loghorrean will soon be awakened and with it we shall usher in a new age. It is you
column2: my loyal supplicants
column3: that have paved the road to our final victory. Your dedication and sacrifice has carried us to the threshold
column4: and I shall see us through.{^n}{^n}The ancients were determined in their construction of this final chamber. One hundred of the imperium's finest arcanists dropped dead to empower the runes which now bind the Loghorrean's tomb. They believed their sacrifice worthy
column5: their seals impenetrable. But we have an army of thousands surging with the power of the Dead God; power that will not be contained.{^n}{^n}I have gladly put a blade to the throats of my most faithful and felt the rush of their life blood escaping; blood they have given willingly in this final hour. With the power of their blood
column6: I have shattered the final seal and begun the ritual. Soon
column7: the Loghorrean shall stir from its eternal slumber. The world will shudder once more under the gaze of the Mouth of Ch'thon.{^n}{^n}Let the blood flow!{^n}{^n}Thalonis
column8: Bloodlord of Ch'thon

column1: 14980=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoreObj_AetherialCity_NoteA01Text=It has become quite obvious that I have angered some very determined enemies. No less than three assassination attempts in as many weeks. Outrageous! My position is not that important to the empire to warrant such aggression. Nor am I that despised by any of the factions within the city
column2: not to my knowledge.{^n}{^n}No
column3: this doesn't feel politically driven. It's as if it were a personal vendetta. With the identities of the assassins pointing in several disparate directions
column4: it is difficult to paint the full picture. I need more information. My advisors now insist that I have four guards with me at all times. What a bother.{^n}{^n}Advisor Aldritch has suggested that
column5: until we know more about the nature of my attackers
column6: I should avoid all public hearings
column7: to minimize risk. I believe he is using this as an opportunity to solidify his position
column8: but he is not wrong either. For now I will play to his tune and stay out of public affairs. Aldritch and the rest of the council will attend to the public while I delve to the bottom of this plot against me.{^n}{^n}-Khallos Strune
column9: Mayor of Port Valbury

column1: 14983=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoreObj_AetherialCity_NoteA02Text=I no longer know what game Aldritch is playing
column2: but it has come at a cost to our citizens and that I cannot allow to continue. Whether out of malice or plain incompetence
column3: I have not been receiving updates regarding recent events in Port Valbury
column4: the tragically mishandled trash issues in old town in particular. I am now hearing rumors of outright revolt and dissent among the citizens.{^n}{^n}Whatever the council had done in my absence was clearly not done in the best interest of the citizenry. Tomorrow I intend to return to the public eye and remove Van Aldritch from the position of High Advisor
column5: risk against my life be damned.{^n}{^n}But there is some good news in all this. Keval
column6: the nightblade once under my employ
column7: has asked to meet. He promises me information regarding a plot against my life.{^n}{^n}- Khallos Strune
column8: Mayor of Port Valbury

column1: 14986=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoreObj_AetherialCity_NoteA03Text=I have had the same recurring dream several nights now. There are some slight variations but the context remains the same.{^n}{^n}Every time
column2: I find myself walking through the looming alleyways of old town. I don't know who I am
column3: but I can feel fine silk slide over my skin as I walk. The ancient and pitted cobblestones under my feet send shards of broken stone flying with each hurried step. An unwholesome fog rolls in from the festering dumping grounds that have begun to spill over the retaining walls and into the main road. For some reason this pleases me.{^n}{^n}I seem to be aware of details and affairs that I should not know. For example
column4: I know that the fog is not natural. It gathers here by the will of an unseen power pulling the strings. In my dreams
column5: this power is familiar to me
column6: almost welcoming
column7: but as soon as I am free of the dream
column8: the meaning is lost upon my waking mind.{^n}{^n}I make haste through the concealing fog towards the Harbormaster's offices. There I find myself in a poorly lit room with two figures obscured by shadows
column9: both men. One is large and loud. He smells of rotting fish and stale beer. The other is also large
column10: but more in physical stature than the girth of his belt. He clinks and scrapes with the sound of metal as he moves. A soldier or town guard perhaps.{^n}{^n}They talk but I cannot make out what they say. The sense of dread and malice that pours from these men is a palpable wave of fire. In my heart I know that the decisions made around that table will mark the end of the world for mankind.{^n}{^n}But last night's dream was different; it kept going. I find myself with a bird's eye view of the city
column11: watching as arcane fire spreads across the horizon. It grows as far as the eye can see and burns all it touches to ash and oblivion. Then
column12: as if floating at the end of a rope
column13: in one hard pull I find myself back in the dark room. The pungent odor of unwashed men and rotting ocean fills my nose. I stare into a cracked mirror hanging on the wall
column14: but I do not see myself staring back. It is the face of the High Advisor
column15: his expression first marked by surprise and then anger. For a brief moment I catch the same fires that consumed the world stirring within his eyes.{^n}{^n}In that instant the dream shattered and I awoke out of breath and tangled in sweat-soaked sheets. But I knew that it was more than just a nightmare spurred by an overactive imagination. He saw me through the glass
column16: just as I saw him. I bore witness to something I was never meant to see. And now my identity is compromised. I must leave this place. Get as far away as I can.{^n}{^n}I will head southeast
column17: across the dark waters. Eerily familiar voices have been calling to me from that area for some time. I don't know why
column18: but in my heart I am certain that safe haven awaits me in the bog. A boat leaves for Burrwitch in the morning. I intend to be on it.{^n}{^n}-Callia

column1: 14989=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoreObj_AetherialCity_NoteA04Text=Notice of Luminari Directive{^n}{^n}The Luminari have long suspected that witches are hiding among regular people
column2: even here in Port Valbury. Any individual performing unsanctioned Arcane acts or dispersing forbidden knowledge without the training and approval of the Gildam Arcanum is rightfully marked as a heretic and a witch. Citizens are reminded that all Arcane knowledge is dangerous without proper training and is strictly controlled for your safety by Imperial Decree.{^n}{^n}Diligent citizens are encouraged to report suspicious activity to the offices of Van Aldritch
column3: High Advisor to the Mayor of Port Valbury. Anyone suspected of witchcraft or harboring a witch will be detained at the local jail and then transported to Malmouth for formal inquiry and trial. Individuals found guilty of the aforementioned crimes will be burnt at the stake
column4: as decreed by the Imperial High Court.{^n}{^n}Responsible citizens who perform their duty in the interest of public safety by reporting these malicious acts will be justly compensated with Imperial coin.{^n}{^n}By order of High Advisor Van Aldritch

column1: 14992=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoreObj_AetherialCity_NoteA05Text=Notice of Law{^n}{^n}To ensure the peace and safety of the citizens of Port Valbury
column2: a curfew is now under immediate and enforceable effect. The decision was not made lightly
column3: but was proven to necessary by the recent rise in criminal elements within our fine city.{^n}{^n}At the sound of the first evening bell
column4: all citizens are to vacate the streets and public venues until the first light of dawn. Any citizen found outside their home after the second bell tolls will be apprehended for questioning by the city guard. Only members of the guard and city officials with special notice from the offices of the Mayor or High Advisor are approved to move about the city after dark.{^n}{^n}The Mayor wishes to emphasize that this is a temporary measure and has your safety and best interests in mind. The curfew will remain in effect until further notice.{^n}{^n}By order of Captain Brastock of the City Guard

column2: I have made contact with many of the less reputable arrivals here at port. I made it clear to them that big changes are on the horizon and permitted them to smuggle in contraband unchecked. In exchange
column3: some of the sailors are now working for me to spread rumors
column4: gather information and...eliminate unwanted interruptions if need be.{^n}{^n}The rumor regarding an impending rise in taxes has caught like wildfire and townspeople are rightfully displeased. We also successfully diverted all garbage collection to the already overflowing dump in old town. The nearby homeowners are naturally very upset by this
column5: and I suspect complaints will soon be arriving at the mayor's offices for you to intercept.{^n}{^n}So long as you keep the mayor oblivious to the larger problems arising in Port Valbury
column6: we should be able to stir up a mob within weeks. Already I am receiving word of growing dissent in taverns and secret gatherings to discuss city matters. The city is reaching a boiling point.{^n}{^n}The fearmongering regarding witches has also turned up far more candidates than we even anticipated. Paranoid
column7: or simply selfish
column8: people are reporting their neighbors for completely innocuous acts
column9: but it is all the excuse the city guard needs to apprehend these women and bring them to the docks
column10: where our new associates smuggle them to Malmouth.{^n}{^n}I take particular delight when I see a noblewoman brought through my doors
column11: knowing that some rich pompous family is forever ruined by rumors and spite. But it will not be long before they all burn for the injustices they enjoyed for generations.{^n}{^n}-Jarren
column12: Port Valbury Harbormaster

column1: 14998=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoreObj_AetherialCity_NoteA07Text=I am writing this for the record in the event that the High Advisor decides to dispose of me
column2: as he already has with the others. I am beginning to fear that I have made a grave error in supporting Van Aldritch in this uprising.{^n}{^n}The initial plan was devious
column3: but it made sense. Local sailors spread rumors of corruption and tax hikes while the city guard overlooked the crimes committed by my subordinates to stir up gossip. I became a bit uneasy when we started using the rumors about witches to smuggle women to Malmouth
column4: but Aldritch reassured me that they would be well taken care of
column5: and we were paid handsomely for each one
column6: so I chose not to question it further.{^n}{^n}One evening
column7: when we gathered to discuss future plans
column8: Aldritch suddenly began acting very strange. He kept looking over his shoulder as if somebody were watching
column9: and his expression became downright ghastly when he stared at the mirror hanging on my wall. He cut the meeting short and demanded that all future discussion be carried out via courier. Very strange
column10: but I did not think much of it at the time. Figured the old man was getting paranoid as his plans came to fruition.{^n}{^n}That left me to deal with Captain Brastock directly. I have never met a more cruel and opportunistic man in my life
column11: and I know every sailor that comes through these parts. I can't imagine it took much to convince him to join the High Advisor's schemes. He informed me that the reports of witches were coming in too slowly
column12: so his men began planting weapons in people's homes to warrant arrests. Each ship sailing to Malmouth is now overflowing with would-be criminals. What Aldritch needs all these people for is beyond me.{^n}{^n}It was not until the day Aldritch asked me to transport several large boxes to him in high town though that I started to suspect that something was amiss. Seemed innocent enough at the time
column13: until one of the crane ropes snapped and a crate dropped several feet onto the cobblestones. The wood splintered in several places and a sickening smell flared up our nostrils and made our skin crawl. The crate shook
column14: as if something was alive in there. I could make out a faint green light through the cracks in the side. I had my men carry that thing out of my docks as soon as able.{^n}{^n}But it was not 'til the day of Captain Brastock's very bloody public execution that I began to suspect that we are all merely pawns in Aldritch's game and that in the end the only winner of this uprising would be none other than the High Advisor himself. Needless to say
column15: I am keeping a close eye on the Mayor's offices and I doubled the pay of my bodyguards. Aldritch isn't going to get rid of me so easily.{^n}{^n}-Jarren

column1: 15001=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoreObj_AetherialCity_NoteA08Text=Menhir have mercy. How much more can go wrong in this rotting city? When the dumping grounds in old town started overflowing with refuse
column2: people started piling up their garbage in the streets. When that wasn't enough
column3: the heavy rains flooded the dumps and caused the retaining walls to break
column4: unleashing a deluge of filth and rot into the district. Those that haven't already left are getting sick. Soon there won't be anyone left in the oldest part of town.{^n}{^n}To make matters worse
column5: the city guard has begun rounding up anybody that speaks up about the recent catastrophes. They search our carts and our homes without asking. Many blatantly steal and look us in the eye as they do it
column6: as if daring us to lash out. If you resist
column7: they arrest you. If they suspect you of plotting against the authorities
column8: they arrest you. Is there no justice left in Valbury?{^n}{^n}I stopped by Owald and Helen's home the other day to find their door broken in and marked with a strange symbol. I'm told Helen was a suspected witch and Owald was taken in for questioning for harboring her all these years. I've never heard a more preposterous thing. I left quickly lest somebody accuse me too.{^n}{^n}This was my home. But now it feels like a dark strange place. It no longer feels safe.

column2: {^n}{^n}I have kept no secrets from you
column3: and you know I have lived a dark and treacherous life. From an early age I was trained to kill. Murder was my trade
column4: the shadows my refuge. I truly believed that was all life had in store for me. But then I found happiness
column5: I found you. Through you
column6: I learned the joys of life
column7: that there is more to me than a blade in the shadows. It was better than I ever deserved
column8: but my old life came at a price. I made many powerful enemies. Enemies I cannot protect you from.{^n}{^n}Some men from my past dealings have come forward with an offer to hide us from those that would seek to harm you in order to get at me
column9: if I do one last job for them. I cannot allow you to become a victim of my former self
column10: so I must ask your forgiveness. I have to do something I swore to you that I would never do again.{^n}{^n}I am writing this letter because I have agreed to take on a very dangerous task. It will ensure your safety. Take the money I have left with this note. Use it to get out of the city and far from here. Do not tell anyone where you are going. If I succeed
column11: I will find you. But if you never hear from me again I want you live your life and know that you were the only light in my dark. Knowing that I've kept you safe is the only reward I need.{^n}{^n}All my love
column12: {^n}{^n}Keval

column1: 15008=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoreObj_AetherialCity_NoteA10Text=Life has been good for us here in Port Valbury. Alden and I have been happily married for 3 years now. Our business is thriving and Alden was hopeful to get a second shop opened up in high town by this time next year. But he came home from the court disappointed. Apparently the mayor has been denying all requests for an audience and his newly appointed High Advisor dismissed Alden's appeal for a deed without even hearing his case.{^n}{^n}Now there's the mess with the garbage spilling out of the old dumping ground. Everyone I've asked doesn't seem to know anything about why trash has been redirected to the already full dump in our district. The new curfew also hasn't been kind to business as we've had to close down early each night.{^n}{^n}Omeer and Shara are both terrified. They think something is wrong and we should all leave the city. Alden says there's nothing to be concerned about.

15012=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoreObj_AetherialCity_NoteA11Text=Several of our neighbors have moved away. They've had enough of the growing garbage problem and the sudden surge in crime here in old town. Omeer and Shara are the latest to leave. Shara was crying when she begged us to come with them. But our business is here and we can't just pack up.{^n}{^n}Food around the city is starting to be rationed. Shops are closing. Alden and I are keeping our shop open
column2: but he has started hiding cheese and other food down in the basement; just in case
column3: he says. I wonder if maybe Shara was right. Maybe we should be leaving too.

column1: 15016=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoreObj_AetherialCity_NoteA12Text=Men broke into the shop. They cleaned out the store and shattered Alden's leg when he resisted. The bone was sticking right through the skin of his thigh and I don't know what to do. The only doctor is in high town
column2: but the bridge has been blocked off by the guard. I wrapped it as best I could but it still bleeds occasionally.{^n}{^n}We've been hiding in the basement since that night. Alden wakes up from time to time
column3: but he seems confused and feverish. We should have left weeks ago when the others did. Occasionally I hear someone entering upstairs and rummaging through the shelves. I hope that they don't discover the stairwell leading down here. I'm so scared.

column1: 15020=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoreObj_AetherialCity_NoteA13Text=Alden hasn't woken up in a day. I tried to make him eat or drink something
column2: but he can't keep anything down. He is so pale. He is going to die soon. I think I have known this fact for days
column3: but I just didn't want to believe it.{^n}{^n}The looters have stopped coming by
column4: likely because there is nothing left to steal. I've braved the upstairs to see what has happened since the fighting stopped and the sight was terrifying to behold. Parts of the city are burning. Most of the homes are abandoned or destroyed. One day
column5: I witnessed a couple running between buildings with their child and a small sack of belongings. I should leave too
column6: but I can't leave Alden.{^n}{^n}I don't understand how the city could turn to this so quickly. One moment
column7: we were planning the next stages of our business
column8: the next the city is in a state of war. The worst of it seems to be over though. It's been quiet
column9: so quiet...

column1: 15024=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoreObj_AetherialCity_NoteA14Text=Last night I heard somebody scream. When I went upstairs to check
column2: I saw some people wandering the streets. But it was a strange
column3: aimless sort of walk. Nobody spoke. Then I heard the scream again and I turned my head to a most grisly sight. A putrid thing of foul flesh dragged a man out of some rubble and disemboweled him. I stifled a scream of my own and quickly ran back downstairs.{^n}{^n}All the commotion had caused my husband to stir and he stood up for the first time in days. But his eyes were glazed over and dull and his movements like the people outside. His skin was chalk white and his chest did not move with the rhythmic breathing of the living. Hands shaking
column4: I grabbed the revolver he gave me and pointed it at his head. He did not talk; he did not even try to move out of the way. He just kept approaching me in a slow unsteady gait. At that moment I understood what wandered the streets outside and I clenched my tear-swollen eyes as I pulled the trigger.{^n}{^n}I can't sleep anymore. My husband's body lies next to me
column5: a hole in his skull. There is nothing left for me here. It's time to go before no hope of escape remains
column6: before my strength has left me. I have to run until my legs can carry me no further; away from Valbury
column7: away from my shattered life.

column1: 15027=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoreObj_AetherialCity_NoteA15Text=I regret to report that our initial efforts in subduing the ruling vessel of Port Valbury have proven unsuccessful. Contrary to previous expectations
column2: this mortal does not exhibit many of the usual vices and mental flaws that allow us to usurp the mind and assume control.{^n}{^n}I believed his lighthearted and jovial demeanor to mean he didn't care about the city and was only interested in the lavish parties and extravagant lifestyle.  This would have been an excellent weakness to exploit
column3: but his outward persona is a mask that masterfully concealed a very sharp mind. Evidently
column4: this is part of his political strategy and has led many an adversary to underestimate him.{^n}{^n}Although my efforts have proven futile
column5: they were not entirely without success for I have found my way into the mind of the mayor's trusted advisor who they call Van Aldritch. He is a petty and scheming man who already harbored desires for the vaunted position we sought in Port Valbury. With a few suggestions
column6: I had entered his mind. He belongs to us now.{^n}{^n}This vessel has many valuable connections within the city
column7: which I had used to orchestrate assassination attempts upon the mayor. While those too proved unsuccessful
column8: they have caused the mayor to become increasingly paranoid and fearful for his wellbeing. As a direct approach seems to be out of the question
column9: I have begun stirring the locals in the interest of destabilizing the region. To facilitate matters
column10: I've used my position to subtly push the mayor's decisions in the direction that suits us so that the growing dissent goes unnoticed until it is far too late.{^n}{^n}While this is contrary to our usual methods
column11: I am confident that Port Valbury will be ready for the imminent Glorious Dawn and no adjustments will be necessary to our established timeline.{^n}{^n}-Van Aldritch
column12: High Advisor of Port Valbury

column1: 15030=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoreObj_AetherialCity_NoteA16Text=I must express my disappointment in the consensus to redirect the vessel Theodin Marcell to the strategically insignificant region of Homestead. While I realize that the unexpected
column2: and still unexplained
column3: sudden disappearance of Anasteria has left the region woefully unsupervised
column4: I believe the attention of the Shaper of Flesh is better served in Malmouth
column5: where his grand work can continue without interruption.{^n}{^n}I understand that splintering the Black Legion's attention between Fort Ikon and the farmlands will be instrumental to their final destruction
column6: but surely such an indelicate matter as the extermination of vermin can be taken upon by a vessel of lesser importance? I anticipate your reply in this matter in due haste so that a new consensus can be achieved without delay and the Shaper of Flesh returned to Malmouth.{^n}{^n}-Overlord Aldritch of Port Valbury

column2: seeker of the truth
column3: to this bastion of knowledge. You have taken your first step along the way to the deeper truths
column4: as countless brothers and sisters have before you. The path now presented to you is a treacherous one. You will be persecuted for your practices
column5: hunted like a rodent by the empire's Luminari hounds; but to persevere
column6: to endure the trials that our patron Lords have endured
column7: that is the way to true power through the eldritch realm.{^n}{^n}You stand before the shrine of Dreeg
column8: the oldest of the three Witch Gods. The Great Guardian sought to know all
column9: to see the truth behind the veil that blinds us all. In arrogance
column10: or perhaps foresight
column11: he cast aside the ancient warnings and the cautionary words of his peers. Dreeg reached into the veil and witnessed the workings of the gods themselves. For his hubris
column12: he was struck blind
column13: but it was then that his eyes had become truly open. Exposed to the wild magic of the eldritch realm
column14: he was forever changed. Cruel spines pierced his flesh
column15: acidic blood dripping from the festering wounds for all eternity. What emerged from beyond the veil bore little resemblance to the man that entered. Dreeg was reborn...a god.{^n}{^n}Dreeg now watches over us all
column16: his peerless gaze pierces through our very souls and sees us for who we really are. To stand before the Great Guardian is an honor without match
column17: to hear His voice is a blessing from the heavens themselves. If you are indeed deserving of his attention
column18: then follow the way of the Three: travel to the broken lands beyond the Arkovian border
column19: where harpies feast on the flesh of the unworthy. Seek a path blocked by stone. If you carry the message of Dreeg
column20: the way shall open before you.

column2: seeker
column3: and seen much
column4: but still the veil between worlds blinds you to the deeper truths. You stumble about the world we inhabit
column5: eager for answers that the Empire and its Luminari deny. They think us heretics
column6: followers of false gods
column7: and yet none of them can claim to have witnessed the power of their deities. Their...illusions.  Show me the cripples that Menhir has cured; the armies that Oleron has toppled; the beasts that Mogdrogen spared from the hunt. You cannot
column8: because they are not real. But the Witch Gods
column9: born of man
column10: had ascended to raise us from our own ignorance. If you are willing to listen
column11: they may open your eyes as well.{^n}{^n}You now stand before the shrine of Solael
column12: the youngest of the Three. Eldritch fire is at his behest
column13: the very essence of the eldritch realm his to mold and shape as he sees fit. Clothed in black robes that hide his gaunt frame
column14: Solael glides unseen through the shadowy veil to hunt unwitting mortals for their vitality. Many a devout of Solael had been asked to make the ultimate sacrifice
column15: to present themselves before the dark god and offer their life so that Solael may bestow his infinite wisdom upon those that remain.{^n}{^n}You
column17: do not yet have the attention of the gods
column18: but know that with each step you take you bring yourself closer to the Three. Go now to the frozen lands of the north
column19: where primitive tribes had constructed standing stones ages ago. Armed with the words of Solael and Dreeg
column20: the way shall be opened to you.

column1: 15041=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoreObj_WitchGods_NoteA03Text=The sight before you may bring you pause
column2: seeker
column3: and rightfully it should for the ignorant followers of Mogdrogen had found their way here. The defilers entered our ritual grounds
column4: befouled the shrine and threatened our secrets. Revenge was swift and justified. Know that their entrails littered the valley
column5: what remained scattered for the mountain yetis to fight over.{^n}{^n}Fear not
column6: seeker of the Hidden Path
column7: for the way forward is secured. Return to the Asterkarn Road and follow it Southeast. Underneath the Legion ramparts
column8: the marked stone awaits. If you are truly sent here by the Three
column9: then the way to Bysmiel shall open to you.

column2: brave seeker
column3: you arrive at the final shrine
column4: the sacred grounds of Bysmiel the Schemer. Through her vast web of servants
column5: Bysmiel tugs on the strings of fate that bind us all. It was she who taught the first occultists in the art of binding eldritch beings and it is through her machinations that the empire is still aimlessly hunting us to this day
column6: their inquisitors confounded by the endless weave of decoys and dead ends. Only a chosen few are privileged to witness even a portion of the Schemer's vast network
column7: and even they could never comprehend it in its entirety if given the opportunity.{^n}{^n}By reaching this far
column8: you too are now a part of Bysmiel's web
column9: forever bound to what you have seen and heard. In your hands you now possess the secret to the Temple of the Three. If you are prepared to commit your very existence to the Witch Gods
column10: then follow the clues contained therein. Your destiny awaits you at the sanctum.

column1: 15047=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoreObj_WitchGods_NoteA05Text=The runes are extinguished one by one; and with each one gone another of my informants falls to the calamity that has consumed the Capital. The world crumbles around us and the temple walls shake with outrage. The Three are not pleased by the incursion. Twice now I have seen heralds thrown out of the Attendant's chamber
column2: their eye sockets hollow with eldritch flame. No
column3: they are not pleased at all.{^n}{^n}Already I can hear scheming whispers among the servants of Solael
column4: wondering if the time has come for us to dissolve the Covenant and seek our own opportunities in this new reality that we face. I dismiss this as the rationale of terrified fools. It is of no concern; the most vocal dissenters had already been offered at Solael's altar. The thralls of Dreeg are as cryptic as ever
column5: their mad ramblings speak of tides of blood shifting in a vast emptiness. They claw at their faces and tear out their hair
column6: their minds barely able to withstand the presence of their god. But it would take someone far wiser and more experienced than I to unravel the disturbing messages Dreeg imparts upon his followers.{^n}{^n}My concerns are only with the weave. With our informants gone silent
column7: we have become blinded to the outside world. The lady Bysmiel demands word from Erulan
column8: but I have nothing to offer. I am beginning to fear that it is my eyes the Attendant will claim next.{^n}{^n}Karrin Taros
column9: Servant of Bysmiel

column2: the Great Eye weeps with tears of blood. The seas rage and the waters run red. The others had fallen silent
column3: but yet the words remain
column4: painted clear on the wall with gore. I study them
column5: but their meaning eludes me. I study them yet I am no wiser. Tell me
column6: great Guardian
column7: what truth escapes me? What does Dreeg desire of this frail form of flesh and bone?{^n}{^n}Your infinite gaze reaches out across the realm. It has seen the unseen. It has witnessed the green flame devour all. Its tendrils threaten our walls
column8: our beliefs
column9: our fates. Tell me
column10: Master of Secrets
column11: what must be done? The blood of the unwilling that I spilled in your name has run dry in my search for your voice. Have you too fallen silent to our pleas?{^n}{^n}The quiet is too quiet. The voices are gone. I must hear their chattering sermons once more or I shall go mad! I must see beyond what I can see. If the gods will not come to me
column12: than I shall seek them where they lay dreaming.{^n}{^n}Ughdar Claz

column1: 15472=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip62TextC=At any time between Crucible monster waves
column2: you can speak to Lokarr's thralls to take advantage of basic services such as a Merchant
column3: Blacksmith and Spirit Guide.

column1: 15474=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip62TextD=Tributes are earned through combat in the Crucible. These can in turn be spent on various features
column2: such as constructing Defenses around the arena or activating powerful Celestial Blessings.

column1: 15476=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip62TextE=Torralia offers unique services available only at the Crucible. Speak to her to spend your precious Tributes on Celestial Blessings and to unlock Devotion Points.
15479=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip63TextA=You've constructed a Crucible Defense. These structures aid you in battle against Lokarr's minions.
15480=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip63TextB=Defenses cannot be destroyed and generate no threat.

column2: empowering their effects and even unlocking a new ability
column3: but the Tribute and Iron Bits cost goes up each time. Each Defense can be upgraded twice.

column1: 15485=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip64TextA=Your efforts in the Crucible have come to an end
column2: either by falling to its cruel machinations or through valiant victory
column3: but that is not the end.

column1: 15486=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip64TextB=You may now enter the Treasure Chamber and claim the reward earned for your progress
column2: score and any additional bonuses you activated at the start.

column1: 15488=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip64TextC=If you wish to compete in the same Crucible again
column2: you may speak to Lokarr to reset the event at the first wave.

column1: 15489=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip64TextD=Note that this will wipe out all chests in the Treasure Room and reset any Defenses you've constructed.

column2: you will also have the option of spending Tributes to restart at the nearest Checkpoint
column3: which is 20 waves before where you stopped
column4: rounding down to the nearest 10th (ex. ending on Wave 55 will restart you on wave 30).

column2: the Tribute cost increases. You may restart up to 3 times.

column1: 15493=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip64TextG=Note that this will wipe out all chests in the Treasure Room and reset any Defenses you've constructed.

column1: 15496=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuickTip63={^z}Crucible Defenses^-}{^n}{^n}You've constructed a Crucible Defense. These structures aid you in battle against Lokarr's minions. Each can be upgraded twice.
