column1: 15499=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoadingTip02={^g}Tip: {^w}If you find a Devotion Shrine you cannot restore yet
column2: its location will be marked on the World Map.

column1: 15500=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoadingTip03={^g}Tip: {^w}You can view Tutorial Tips again at any time in the Codex Window
column2: default hotkey: H.

column1: 15501=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoadingTip04={^g}Tip: {^w}Enemies significantly below your level do not grant Experience or Faction Reputation.
15502=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoadingTip05={^g}Tip: {^w}Remember to invest in the Mastery Bar. It provides core stats that will help you survive and gear up.
15503=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoadingTip06={^g}Tip: {^w}Visit www.GrimDawn.com to read the Game Guide
column2: which has a wealth of information on game mechanics.

column1: 15504=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoadingTip07={^g}Tip: {^w}Hero Monsters (marked by a Star) are powerful foes with unique abilities
column2: but also better loot.

column1: 15505=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoadingTip08={^g}Tip: {^w}Enemies significantly below your level will not drop Rare Crafting Materials such as Ancient Hearts.

column2: your core resistances are reduced by 25%. That penalty goes up to 50% on Ultimate.

column1: 15507=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoadingTip10={^g}Tip: {^w}There are many secret places in the world of Cairn. Look closely and you may find hidden treasure!

column2: Bosses will regain a portion of their health if you are killed.

column1: 15509=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoadingTip12={^g}Tip: {^w}Explore the world to find One-Shot Chests
column2: which will always drop an Epic item
column3: once per character.

column1: 15510=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoadingTip13={^g}Tip: {^w}Epic and Legendary items can grant you unique abilities that can complement
column2: or even define
column3: your build.

column1: 15511=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoadingTip14={^g}Tip: {^w}Some monsters can drop equipment unique to them
column2: known as Monster Infrequents.
but also incredibly powerful. They start dropping at level 50+.

column1: 15513=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoadingTip16={^g}Tip: {^w}Set items have powerful bonuses if worn together and can even grant new skills.
15514=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoadingTip17={^g}Tip: {^w}Components used on weapons grant an activated skill that you can use to complement your build.
15515=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoadingTip18={^g}Tip: {^w}Relics are special items that can only be created by a skilled Blacksmith.
15516=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoadingTip19={^g}Tip: {^w}Many Components can only be crafted. Learn new Blueprints by gaining favor with Cairn's Factions.
15517=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagLoadingTip20={^g}Tip: {^w}You have better chance of finding great loot on higher difficulties
column2: but the challenge is also greater.

column1: 15522=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip06TextA=Abandoned meals are found throughout the world of Cairn. Likely left behind by less fortunate adventurers
column2: they can be consumed to restore some of your lost Constitution.

column1: 15525=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip08TextA=Thank you for supporting us and our work. Grim Dawn was made possible by the generosity of our backers
column2: whether through our Website
column3: Kickstarter or Steam Early Access.

column2: please report it on our forums at www.grimdawn.com.

column1: 15528=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip08TextC=You can enable or disable in game tutorial tips at any time on the options menu. The options menu can be accessed in-game by pressing {^x}[Escape]{^-}.
15531=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip09TextA=Merchants buy and sell weapons and equipment necessary to survive the dangers of Cairn.

column2: good equipment doesn't come cheap. Merchants won't pay much for common items
column3: but magically imbued gear can fetch a good price.

column1: 15535=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip10TextA=Secured Riftgates allow you to traverse quickly between locations. Left-click on a Riftgate to open the World Map and select a destination.

column2: you are capable of opening Personal Riftgates. To activate your Personal Riftgate
column3: click on the Rift Travel button located to the right of your skill bar
column4: or press {^x}[%t0]{^-}.

column1: 15538=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip10TextC=Personal Riftgates can be opened almost anywhere in the world
column2: and are linked to the main Riftgate network. Your Riftgate will remain open until you return to it
column3: and while it remains open your party members may travel to it as well. You can only have one Personal Riftgate open at any given time.

column1: 15541=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip14TextA=Health and Energy Potions restore your character's health and energy
column2: respectively. To drink a potion
column3: click on its image on the skill bar or press the assigned hotkey.

column1: 15542=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip14TextB=Potions are initially assigned to the last two Skill Bar Slots. You can manually assign Potions to any Skill Bar slot by right-clicking on an empty slot and selecting a potion from the menu.

column2: click on its image in the Skill Bar or press the assigned hotkey.

column1: 15544=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip14TextD=You will find potions in chests and from monsters
column2: but you can always purchase more from any merchant if you find yourself running low.
you will earn Skill and Attribute points.

column1: 15548=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip15TextB=Attribute points can be used to increase your Cunning
column2: Physique and Spirit by 8 per point.

column1: 15549=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip15TextC=Skill points can be used to increase your mastery level
column2: unlock new skills
column3: or improve skills you have already unlocked.

column2: you will earn 3 skill points per level
column3: but as you achieve higher levels
column4: the number of skills points gained will eventually go down to 2 and finally 1 per level.

column1: 15552=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip15TextE=Attribute points are assigned in the Character Window. Click the icon to the left of the skill bar
column2: or press {^x}[%t0]{^-}. To assign an attribute point
column3: click the "+" next to the appropriate attribute.

column1: 15553=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip15TextF=Skill points are assigned by opening the Skill Window. Click the icon to the left of the skill bar
column2: or press {^x}[%t0]{^-}.

column1: 15555=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip15TextG=You can track your experience on the yellow bar below your health and energy
column2: and in the Character Window. The bar shows your current experience
column3: experience gain
column4: and experience required to reach the next level. When the bar fills up
column5: you gain a level.

column1: 15558=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip16TextA=Use the Character Window to equip items
column2: organize your inventory
column3: spend attribute points and see a summary of your character's stats. Hover over stats for additional information.

column2: right-click it from your inventory or move it to an appropriate equipment slot. You may drop an item by moving it out of the character window
column3: or by clicking on it and pressing the {^x}[{%t0}]{^-} key.

column1: 15562=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip16TextC=Spend attribute points by clicking on the "+" buttons to the left of the desired attribute. Each attribute point increases the attribute by 8.
15565=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip17TextA=Choosing a mastery is a character-defining decision. Different masteries cater to very different play styles
column2: so choose wisely.

column1: 15566=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip17TextB=Once you choose a mastery and apply skill points
column2: you will not be able to revert your mastery selection.

column1: 15567=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip17TextC=You will have the option to select a second mastery when your character reaches level 10.
15570=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip20TextA=Components can be used to upgrade your equipment. They always come in fragments
column2: which can be combined for more potent bonuses. Rare components are denoted by a light yellow border.
then left-click on the item you wish to attach it to. Note that each component can only go in certain item types.

column1: 15574=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip20TextC=You can combine component fragments of the same name to create more powerful bonuses.
15575=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip20TextD=Component fragments of the same type may be attached to items after the first fragment has been applied.
15578=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip22TextA=You will earn additional skill points each time you gain a level. Invest these skill points in your mastery level or unlocked skills.
15580=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip22TextB=If you invest skill points in your skill mastery
column2: you will unlock new tiers of skills. You can increase your mastery level by clicking on the mastery button in the lower left of the Skill Window.

column1: 15581=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip22TextC=You must have at least one point in your mastery level to unlock the first skill tier.

15583=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip22TextD=Click on an unlocked skill icon to add points to that skill. The first skill point will allow you to use the ability. Additional skill points will make the ability more powerful.

15584=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip22TextE=Green lines indicate connections to that skill's modifiers. You must have at least one point in the base skill before you can invest in its modifiers.
15587=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip23TextA=Active skills (square icons) need to be assigned to your mouse buttons or skill bar before you can use them.

column2: right-click on a slot in the skill bar or on the mouse buttons to the right of it and select the desired skill from the menu.

column1: 15590=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip23TextC=Activate skills on the skill bar by left-clicking the icon
column2: or by pressing the assigned shortcut.

column1: 15591=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip23TextD=Passive skills (circular icons) are always active and do not need to be assigned to the skill bar. Once you assign points to them
column2: they will immediately provide their benefits.
your character will die. Dying costs experience and returns your character to the last sanctuary you visited. You can regain some of your lost experience by recovering your Grave Marker.
take advantage of your character's rapid health regeneration
column3: which activates when out of combat for a few seconds. When your constitution has been depleted
column4: remember to use potions and skills to stay alive.

column1: 15598=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip26TextA=You can use the Chat Window to send messages to other players in your game session. To send a private message
column2: choose a recipient by clicking on the "Send To" button.
shift-click on the desired item with the chat open. A message will be automatically sent with a link to the item.

column1: 15603=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip27TextA=Joining a party with other players allows you to share experience and loot. You can access the Group Window by clicking the icon
column2: or by pressing {^x}[%t0]{^-}. Parties are also important for PvP sessions.

column1: 15604=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip27TextB=You can initiate a trade with another player in your party by right-clicking on their portrait and choosing "Trade".
15605=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip27TextC=You can also chat with other players in the game by using the Chat Window
column2: which can be opened by pressing {^x}[%t0]{^-}.

column1: 15608=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip28TextA=You can trade items by placing them within your side of the trade window. You can trade iron bits by typing a value next to the icon at the top of the window.
15609=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip28TextB=Both players must accept the trade before an exchange will take place. If the trade is cancelled
column2: all items and iron bits are returned to player inventories.

column1: 15612=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip33TextA=When leveling up it's important to allocate points to skills as well as putting points in your class mastery bar. Learning new skills can provide you with powerful offensive and defensive abilities.
15613=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip33TextB=To apply skill points to an ability
column2: click on an unlocked skill icon in the Skill Window. The first skill point will allow you to use the ability. Additional skill points will make the ability more powerful.
you may wish to visit a merchant and sell unwanted items.

column1: 15617=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip34TextB=Merchants can be found in human-controlled sanctuaries
column2: but you may also encounter traveling merchants out in the world. Look for the merchant symbol on the Compass or in the Map Window.

column1: 15620=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip35TextA=Pets automatically travel and fight alongside you. If you wish to give your pets direct commands
column2: you can hold down {^x}[{%t0}]{^-} while clicking on the desired pet in the upper left of the screen
column3: then select a target.

column1: 15621=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip35TextB=You can dismiss your pets at any time by right-clicking their portraits and selecting "Disband Pet".
15622=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip35TextC=You can order all pets to attack or move to a target by commanding them using the Pet Attack skill. To assign this skill
column2: right-click on a slot in the Skill Bar or on the mouse buttons to the right of it and select it from the menu.

column1: 15625=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip36TextA=Spirit Guides allow you to undo your skill point selections. Click on a skill icon in the Spirit Guide's UI to remove one point from that skill. The cost of doing so increases as you remove subsequent skill points.
15626=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip36TextB=You cannot remove points invested in your Mastery level. In addition
column2: you cannot remove the last point from a skill that has any modifiers with points invested in them.
and even exchange them between your characters! You can access your stash at any Smuggler you find throughout Cairn.

column1: 15630=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip37TextB=Items can be transferred quickly using Shift-Left Click.
15631=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip37TextC=Click on Item Transfer to share items with your other characters.
15634=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip38TextA=Items placed in the Smuggler's Item Transfer Window are shared between all your characters (separated by Normal and Hardcore mode).

15635=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip38TextB=You can expand your shared storage by purchasing additional tabs for iron bits. These additional tabs are visible along the left side of the transfer window.

column2: place them in the Item Transfer Window. When you load another character
column3: you can access these items from the Smuggler.

column1: 15639=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip38TextD=In order to trade items with other player's characters in multiplayer games
column2: you must use the Trade function instead. Right click the player's portrait
column3: and choose "Trade".

column1: 15642=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip39TextA=Inventors are capable of removing Components and Augments from items. Either the item or the component is preserved in the process. Any Augments are lost.
15644=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip39TextB=The removal of Components from items costs a fee proportional to the combined value of the item
column2: Augment and the Component. Place an item with a Component in the Salvage Window to begin.

column1: 15645=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip39TextC=You can recover either the item or the component
column2: but the other is destroyed in the process.

column1: 15647=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip39TextD=Whenever you choose to remove just an Augment
column2: the item and Component are unchanged. If a Soulbound Augment is removed this way
column3: and the item was not originally Soulbound
column4: the Soulbound status will be removed as well.

column1: 15650=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip42TextA=The Blacksmith is capable of crafting items of great power. He is already an experienced craftsman and everything he creates comes with a small crafting stat bonus
column2: but his knowledge can be expanded upon with the discovery of new blueprints.

column1: 15652=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip42TextB=The Blacksmith will learn to craft new items when you discover new blueprints. Blueprints can be earned from quests
column2: or found out in the world.
select a recipe in the Crafting UI. Items are automatically placed in the crafting UI
column3: taken from your Personal Stash
column4: Shared Stash
column5: Inventory and Equipped items
column6: in that order.

column1: 15655=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip42TextD=If you have all the required materials
column2: you can press the Combine button to craft the item.

column1: 15658=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip43TextA=Blueprints are forgotten templates for the creation of powerful items
column2: which a Blacksmith can study.
right-click on it. If you have not yet learned this blueprint
column3: it will be added to your Blacksmith's list of items.

column1: 15660=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip43TextC=Blueprints are stored across all characters (separated by Normal and Hardcore mode) and you can only learn each Blueprint once.

column2: but you do not have a Blacksmith capable of crafting the item for you.{^n}{^n}You must first find a Blacksmith before you can craft items.{^n}{^n}The Blacksmith will know how to craft this new blueprint immediately.

column1: 15667=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip45TextA=When combat ends and your health bar is not full
column2: a secondary regeneration system activates called Constitution.

column1: 15668=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip45TextB=Constitution will rapidly refill your health bar
column2: but will also be drained in the process. The yellow indicator over your health bar is your Constitution.{^N}{^N}

column1: 15669=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip45TextC=Constitution automatically refills when you find Food Rations or Vital Essence
column2: and when you reach the next Character Level or Die.
you will no longer rapidly regenerate health outside of combat.

column1: 15673=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip46TextA=You have run out of Constitution and will no longer rapidly regenerate health out of combat. You can restore your Constitution with Food Rations or Vital Essence.
15676=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip47TextA=Visit the Inventor to break down items into Scrap
column2: with a chance of generating a Component piece. The more powerful the item
column3: the more likely it will generate powerful Components.

column2: you will require Dynamite and iron bits. A Dismantled item is destroyed forever. Place an item of at least Magical quality in the Dismantling Window to begin.
the required Dynamite and iron bits cost is deducted from your inventory and the item is converted to its basic parts.

column1: 15682=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip49TextA=When you hover over an item in your inventory. You will see a side-by-side comparison of that item with what you currently have equipped. In the case of weapons
column2: you will also see additional information comparing the Damage per Second (DPS).

column1: 15684=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip49TextB=You can compare the two weapons without any attached components by holding the {^x}[Ctrl]{^-} key.
15687=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip50TextA=Augments come in the form of enchanted powders
column2: which can be used to upgrade your equipment. The creation of Augments is a carefully guarded secret of Cairn's various Factions.
right-click on it. You can then apply it to an appropriate item. Once applied
column3: an Augment cannot be removed
column4: but it can be replaced with another.

column2: then left-click on the item you wish to apply it to.

column1: 15692=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip51TextB=Note that Augments can only be applied to specific item types and cannot be removed once applied; but you can overwrite an existing Augment with another.

15695=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip53TextA=Faction Quartermasters sell items exclusively available from his or her faction. This equipment is only available to those who have proven themselves to their faction.
15697=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip53TextB=Equipment sold by Faction Quartermasters is soulbound to your character and cannot be traded or placed in the Transfer UI.
15698=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip53TextC=If a Soulbound Augment is applied to an item
column2: that item becomes soulbound as well.

column1: 15701=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip55TextA=Use the Faction Window to keep track of your progress with Cairn's various factions and to determine what you need to do in order to gain their favor.
15703=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip55TextB=Each faction has unique desires and goals. You can see how to earn their respect by looking at the "Reputation Gained From" section.

15704=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip55TextC=Your reputation levels determine how the various factions in the world of Cairn act towards you. Higher reputation levels entitle you to discounted goods at all of the faction's merchants and access to better equipment from their Faction Quartermaster.
15705=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip55TextD=As your rise through the different reputation levels new quests may become available. Don't forget to seek them out.
15706=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip55TextE=Note that as you become more renowned
column2: you will need to defeat tougher monsters to gain reputation from kills.

column1: 15709=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip56TextA=Bounties are an excellent way to raise your reputation with the various factions of Cairn. Bounty quests send you on tasks of varying difficulty and reward and are generally unguided. You must hunt down your prey with limited assistance.

column2: Bounty quests are not limited to once per character. Each Faction will offer you up to 5 Bounties per game session
column3: and you may discover Bounties you have completed in previous sessions.{^N}{^N}

column1: 15714=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip59TextA=Devotion Shrines are ancient remnants of a long-lost empire
column2: monuments dedicated to various gods and celestial symbols. Shrines must either be cleansed by defeating a corrupting presence trapped within or restored by placing an offering of rare crafting materials. The requirements vary from shrine to shrine.
you must have the required materials in your Personal Stash
column3: Shared Stash
column4: Inventory and Equipped items
column5: taken automatically in that order. If you have all the required materials
column6: you can press the Offer button to restore the Shrine.

column1: 15718=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip59TextC=When a shrine is cleansed you earn a devotion point. To allocate your Devotion Points visit the Devotion Window
column2: which can be accessed through the Skill Window. Click the icon located to the left of the skill bar
column3: or press {^x}[%t0]{^-}.

column1: 15721=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip60TextA=The Devotion Window allows you to dedicate your Devotion Points to various deities and celestial symbols of Cairn.

column2: you will earn Affinity
column3: which will in-turn earn you access to more powerful Constellations.

column1: 15724=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip60TextC=The Constellations are aligned to five different Affinities
column2: representing different celestial aspects. Different Constellations require different amounts of Affinity to unlock.

column1: 15726=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip60TextD=The entry Constellations all give significant Affinity bonuses
column2: while the most powerful Constellations do not give any at all.

column1: 15727=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip60TextE=Note that if you unlearn a piece of a completed Constellation
column2: you will lose its Affinity bonus.

column1: 15728=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip60TextF=Bright blue stars indicate where you can put a Devotion Point in next. Left-click on a star to unlock its bonus.
15729=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip60TextG=The Halo Stars mark the locations of Celestial Powers
column2: which you can unlock to enhance your primary skills with new effects.

column1: 15732=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagTutorialTip61TextA=Celestial Powers are powerful auto-activated abilities which can be assigned to your primary skills from your Masteries and Equipment. Celestial Powers assigned to your skills will earn experience from combat and quests
column2: which will cause them to rank up and increase in strength. When assigned to pet skills
column3: they will scale with the pet's damage.

column2: you must first unlock it in the Devotion Window
column3: then select a valid Primary Skill from the drop-down list. You can re-assign a Celestial Power at any time without penalty. If you unassign a Celestial Power
column4: it will retain any experience or ranks it has earned.

column1: 15738=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuickTipMainMenu={^z}Welcome to Grim Dawn!{^-}{^n}{^n}{^w}Tutorial Tips{^-} are currently enabled. You can disable them at any time via the options menu.{^n}{^n}{^w}Normal Difficulty{^-} is intended for less experienced ARPG players.{^n}{^n}For a more challenging experience select {^w}Veteran Difficulty{^-}.
15739=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuickTip06={^z}Untouched Meal{^-}Collecting an untouched meal restores a large amount of Constitution
column2: which allows you to regenerate Health quickly when out of combat.

column1: 15740=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuickTip07={^z}You Unlocked a Riftgate!{^-}{^n}{^n}{^w}Rift Travel{^-} {^x}[%t0]{^-} allows you to create a portal which you can use to teleport to the Riftgates found throughout the world of Cairn.
15741=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuickTip08={^z}Tutorial Tips{^-}{^n}{^n}{^s}Tutorial Tips{^-} are currently enabled. You can disable them at any time via the options menu. For more information
column2: simply left click on a tip as it appears
column3: or right click to close it. In game help is accessible at any time in the Codex Window {^x}[%t0]{^-}.

column1: 15742=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuickTip09={^z}Merchants{^-}{^n}{^n}Merchants allow you to sell your collected loot and buy equipment and potions. Right clicking an item is a the quickest way to buy or sell.
15743=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuickTip11={^z}Personal Riftgate{^-}{^n}{^n}Use the Personal Riftgate to open the World Map and select a Riftgate to travel to.

column2: but they can be used to quickly restore your Health or Energy. To drink a potion
column3: click on the potion icon on the skill bar or press the assigned hotkey.

column1: 15745=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuickTip15={^z}Leveling{^-}{^n}{^n}When you level up you gain Skill and Attribute points which can be assigned in the Skill and Character Windows.
15746=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuickTip16={^z}Character Window{^-}{^n}{^n}The Character Window allows you to manage your Inventory
column2: Equipment
column3: and view your Stats.

column1: 15747=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuickTip20={^z}Components{^-}{^n}{^n}Components apply bonuses to items and equipment
column2: and can be combined for an increase in power.
and can now select a second Mastery.

column1: 15749=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuickTip22={^z}Skill Window{^-}{^n}{^n}The Skill Window {^x}[%t0]{^-} allows you to spend the Skill Points you earn when leveling up.

15750=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuickTip23={^z}Mastery & Skills{^-}{^n}{^n}Increasing the number of points spent in the Mastery Bar allows access to additional skills as well as providing stat bonuses. Remember to learn new skills as well as increasing your mastery.
15751=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuickTip24={^z}Death is Not The End!{^-}{^n}{^n}When you die you lose experience
column2: but you can recover some of the experience you lost by collecting your Grave Marker.
or press "Send To" to send a Private Message. Shift-clicking an item sends a viewable link to that item to other players in the game.

column1: 15753=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuickTip27={^z}Multiplayer{^-}{^n}{^n}Access the Group Window {^x}[%t0]{^-} to form a party. Press {^x}[Enter]{^-} to chat with other players.

15754=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuickTip30={^z}Unassigned Skills!{^-}{^n}{^n}Active skills must be assigned to the skill bar before they can be used. Right click a slot on the bar to assign a skill to it.
15755=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuickTip31={^z}Health Potions{^-}{^n}{^n}When your health is low during combat
column2: use a potion to restore it. Health Potions have a long cooldown but restore a large amount of health.

column1: 15756=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuickTip32={^z}Unassigned Points!{^-}{^n}{^n}You have unassigned attribute or skill points. Remember to spend your points when leveling up.

15757=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuickTip33={^z}Learning Skills{^-}{^n}{^n}It's important to learn Skills as well as increasing your Mastery bar. Skills provide you with powerful offensive and defensive abilities.
15758=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuickTip34={^z}Inventory Full!{^-}{^n}{^n}Open the Character Window to manage your inventory
column2: or visit a merchant to sell the loot you have collected in exchange for iron bits.

column1: 15759=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuickTip35={^z}Summoned Pets{^-}{^n}{^n}You can order all pets to attack or move to a target by commanding them using the Pet Attack skill. They can also be set to aggressive/defensive
column2: and desummoned when required.

column1: 15760=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuickTip36={^z}Spirit Guide{^-}{^n}{^n}The Spirit Guide allows you to change your skills and devotions in exchange for Iron Bits and Aether Crystals. Each point refunded increases the cost of the next point.
15761=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuickTip37={^z}Smuggler{^-}{^n}{^n}The Smuggler allows you to store items you wish to save for later in your Private Stash
column2: as well as access the Transfer Stash.

column1: 15762=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuickTip38={^z}Transfer Stash{^-}{^n}{^n}The Transfer Stash can be used to transfer items between your character. Additional transfer space can be purchased for Iron Bits.
15763=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuickTip39={^z}Inventor{^-}{^n}{^n}The Inventor allows you to recover Components from items
column2: and Dismantle unwanted items into crafting materials.

column1: 15764=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuickTip42={^z}Blacksmith{^-}{^n}{^n}The Blacksmith allows you to craft powerful items using the Blueprints you have learned and various crafting components found in the world.
15765=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuickTip43=^{z}Blueprints{^-}{^n}{^n}Visit the Blacksmith to craft items using the Blueprints you have learned
column2: and the crafting materials you have found.

column1: 15766=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuickTip44={^z}Blueprints{^-}{^n}{^n}Blueprints require the services of a Blacksmith to craft. Any blueprints you collect will be stored until you recruit one.
15767=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuickTip45={^z}Fast Regen{^-}{^n}{^n}Constitution is converted into health when out of combat
column2: allowing you to regenerate quickly between fights while your constitution lasts.

column1: 15768=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuickTip46={^z}Constitution Exhausted!{^-}{^n}{^n}When your Constitution runs out you can no longer regenerate Health quickly when out of combat. Collect Untouched Meals and Vital Essence in order to refill your constitution bar.
15769=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuickTip47={^z}Dismantling{^-}{^n}{^n}The Dismantle Window allows you to break unwanted items down into their component parts
column2: which can then be used for crafting.

column1: 15770=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuickTip49={^z}Equipment Comparison{^-}{^n}{^n}Placing the cursor over an item will show a comparison of that item with your current equipment.

15771=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuickTip50={^z}Augments{^-}{^n}{^n}Augments can be used on equipment to add additional bonuses. They can be purchased from Faction Quartermasters when you have met the reputation requirements.

15772=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuickTip52={^z}Reputation Gained{^-}{^n}{^n}You have gained some reputation with one of Cairn's factions. You can view your reputation status in the in the Factions Window {^x}[%t0]{^-}.

15773=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuickTip53={^z}Faction Quartermaster{^-}{^n}{^n}Faction Quartermasters allow you to purchase faction related items and enhancements if your reputation meets their requirements.

15774=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuickTip54={^z}Reputation{^-}{^n}{^n}Your Reputation level has increased with one of Cairn's factions. The Factions Window {^x}[%t0]{^-} contains information on the rewards associated with higher reputation levels.
15775=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuickTip55={^z}Faction Window{^-}{^n}{^n}The Faction Window allows you to view your current Reputation with the various friendly and enemy factions
column2: and learn background information about them.
bounties are repeatable. Each faction will offer you up to 5 bounties per game session.

column1: 15777=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuickTip57={^z}Devotion Shrines{^-}{^n}{^n}Cleansing shrines grants you Devotion Points which can be allocated by accessing the Skills Window {^x}[%t0]{^-}. Devotion is an additional layer of character customization in addition to the Mastery system.
15778=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuickTip58={^z}Cleansing Shrines{^-}{^n}{^n}Shrines can be cleansed by either making an offering to the gods
column2: or defeating foes trapped within the shrine
column3: depending on the type of shrine you encounter.

column1: 15779=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuickTip59={^z}Devotion Points{^-}{^n}{^n}Devotions Points earned from cleansing shrines can be spent in the Devotion Window
column2: accessed via the Skills Window {^x}[%t0]{^-}.

column1: 15780=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuickTip60={^z}Devotion Window{^-}{^n}{^n}The Devotion Window allows you to spend Devotion points gained by cleansing shrines. Each spent point allows you to unlock new bonuses and skills.

15781=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuickTip61={^z}Celestial Powers{^-}{^n}{^n}Assign your Celestial Power to a skill by clicking the icon in the Devotion Window and selecting a skill from the list.﻿#General
15841=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagRiftgateError01=You cannot use this rift.  It was created by a player not in your group.
15842=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagRiftgateError02=You cannot teleport to this Riftgate from the same Riftgate.
15843=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagRiftgateError03=You cannot teleport to this Riftgate from here.
15844=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagRiftgateDialog01=Opening a new rift will close your existing one.  Do you wish to proceed?
15905=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagQuestBlockedDescription=Quest Locked in this Session based on Host's Progress.

15919=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagFactionSurvivorsInfo=Headquarters: Devil's Crossing {^n}{^n} Survivors...that is the word used most often to describe the hardy denizens of Devil's Crossing. The men and women who made it through the Grim Dawn to form a small community within the ruins of an abandoned prison. They have seen all too many friends and family lost to the "Taken"
column2: those found possessed by the Aetherials.{^n}{^n} Earning their trust will prove no easy task
column3: but with supplies running low and a looming Aetherial threat on the horizon
column4: they may just be willing to take a chance.

column1: 15925=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagFactionSurvivorsRewards6=New Quest {^n}Access to Bounty Table {^n}Faction Weapons {^n}Faction Armor {^n}Faction Blueprints
15927=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagFactionSurvivorsRewards8=Rare Augments {^n}Faction Mandates {^n}Elite Faction Weapons {^n}Elite Faction Armor
15929=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagFactionAetherialsInfo= Foolishly and greedily did the arcanists of Cairn delve into the magical veil known as the Aether
column2: never once suspecting that something was looking back. {^n}{^n} The Aetherials descended upon Cairn in what is now known as the Grim Dawn
column3: possessing countless humans and butchering the rest. Most despicably of all
column4: they began raising the fallen as mutated undead creatures
column5: mindless foot soldiers for their invasion. Their very presence on Cairn is enough to mutate the wildlife
column6: turning once docile creatures into vicious monstrosities. {^n}{^n} But most strange of all is their apparent hatred for Chthonians
column7: as they will battle against the horrors from the Void at every opportunity.

column2: horrors from the Void
column3: are the things of nightmares. Prior to the Grim Dawn
column4: Chthonians would only be seen upon Cairn following an arcane ritual gone wrong or at the beckoning of a powerful sorcerer. {^n}{^n} Despite an effort to exterminate the practice
column5: a cult has formed around blood rituals and the worship of Chthonic beings. Members of the cult have been overheard chanting one name in particular: Ch'thon. With the world in disarray
column6: the cult has grown strong
column7: garnering new followers desperate for answers in a world that no longer makes sense. {^n}{^n} Chthonians
column8: and their loyal cult
column9: appear to be at odds with the Aetherials
column10: eagerly harvesting helpless humans for blood so that the Aetherials cannot use them as vessels.

column1: 15949=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagFactionOutlawsInfo= Unlike most groups of roaming bandits
column2: Cronley's Gang appears to be highly organized and heavily armed
column3: answering only to their self-proclaimed leader
column4: Darius Cronley. {^n}{^n} Having escaped Devil's Crossing Prison following the chaos that ensued after the Grim Dawn
column5: these criminals are now intent on taking the one place in the world that once denied them their freedom. Members of Cronley's Gang are sadistic
column6: violent and prone to acts of aggression against their fellow humans
column7: epitomizing that perhaps the greatest threat to humanity is humanity itself.

column2: or Rovers as they are commonly called
column3: are a group of people without a permanent home. To them
column4: the open road is the only home they will ever need
column5: traveling the world of Cairn in a lifelong pilgrimage to cleanse themselves of worldly temptations and the corruption of civilization. Much of their history had been lost to the ages
column6: and most cultures consider them to be little more than vagrants and petty thieves. {^n}{^n} Rovers abhor violence
column7: and will try to avoid it at any cost
column8: which has often led to abuse at the hands of more violent individuals.

column1: 15967=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagFactionUser0Rewards6=Access to Bounty Table {^n}Faction Weapons {^n}Faction Armor {^n}Faction Blueprints
15969=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagFactionUser0Rewards8=Rare Augments {^n}Faction Mandates {^n}Elite Faction Weapons {^n}Elite Faction Armor
15973=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagFactionUser2Info=Headquarters: Homestead {^n}{^n} Whenever trouble would strike the northern farmlands
column2: the farmers and their families would rally at Homestead. This sense of community has proven more important than ever as humanity faces extinction. {^n}{^n} With assistance from the Black Legion
column3: Homestead was turned into a veritable fortress
column4: a place of relative safety in a world ravaged by death; but with powerful enemies encroaching from every direction
column5: some are beginning to wonder if entrenching in a fixed location was a wise decision. {^n}{^n} While the Black Legion obsesses over the Aetherials and the Chthonians
column6: the people of Homestead are focused on a threat much closer to home: the voracious Dermapteran swarm
column7: which has spread rampantly and now infests their abandoned fields.

column1: 15979=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagFactionUser2Rewards6=Access to Bounty Table {^n}Faction Weapons {^n}Faction Armor {^n}Faction Blueprints
15981=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagFactionUser2Rewards8=Rare Augments {^n}Faction Mandates {^n}Elite Faction Weapons {^n}Elite Faction Armor

15993=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagFactionUser4Info=Headquarters: Fort Ikon {^n}{^n} Not much is known about the enigmatic Anasteria or why she knows so much about the Aetherials and their plans. She seemingly arrived out of nowhere
column2: providing the Black Legion with information on enemy activity that has saved precious lives. {^n}{^n} Many in the Black Legion have branded her a witch
column3: and would gladly see her burnt at the stake despite Inquisitor Creed's insistence that she be kept safe.

column1: 16001=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagFactionUser4Rewards8=Rare Augments {^n}Faction Mandates {^n}Elite Faction Weapons {^n}Elite Faction Armor
16003=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagFactionUser5Info=Headquarters: Sorrow's Bastion {^n}{^n} The Order of Death's Vigil represents the last connection to the nearly lost art of necromancy
column2: precious knowledge passed down to its members from their grandmaster
column3: Uroboruuk. {^n}{^n} Members of the Order do not fear death. Instead they embrace all of its harsh lessons
column4: believing that through mastery of death they can become more in tune with the world itself. {^n}{^n} Having faced persecution at the hands of the empire for centuries
column5: the Order is no stranger to prejudice and controversy
column6: but they had never met a foe as relentless as the Kymon's Chosen. The Chosen
column7: concerned only with cleansing Cairn of corruption
column8: view the Order as a travesty that must be purged.

column1: 16009=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagFactionUser5Rewards6=New Quest {^n}Access to Bounty Table {^n}Faction Weapons {^n}Faction Armor {^n}Faction Blueprints
16011=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagFactionUser5Rewards8=Rare Augments {^n}Faction Mandates {^n}Elite Faction Weapons {^n}Elite Faction Armor
16013=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagFactionUser6Info=Many tragic tales are told about the undead endlessly roaming the ruins of Arkovia. Some believe them to be spirits trapped within the mortal realm
column2: unable to cross over into their promised afterlife. Others will claim it to be the work of vile necromancy
column3: a legion of undead cursed to serve a cruel master. Perhaps the truth lies somewhere in-between. {^n}{^n} One thing everyone can agree upon is that the undead are extremely dangerous to the living. As such
column4: looting their forgotten ruins is considered to be an ill-advised pursuit.

column1: 16023=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagFactionUser7Info=Headquarters: Fort Ikon {^n}{^n} The Black Legion are the imperium's elite
column2: Death's Bannermen sent forth to act out the emperor's will with great prejudice. Legends of their valor intermingle with equally common tales of their cruelty and violence. {^n}{^n} Regardless of whether they are respected or feared
column3: the Black Legion was the only imperial regiment to escape the fallen capital following the Grim Dawn and may now represent the only hope humanity has left of ever fighting back.

column1: 16028=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagFactionUser7Rewards5=Access to Bounty Table {^n}Access to Faction Vendor
16031=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagFactionUser7Rewards8=Rare Augments {^n}Faction Mandates {^n}Elite Faction Weapons {^n}Elite Faction Armor
16033=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagFactionUser8Info=Headquarters: Sorrow's Bastion {^n}{^n} Kymon's Chosen are the zealous followers of Empyrion
column2: the Light-Bringer
column3: whom they believe will return to Cairn in blazing glory and guide his Chosen into a new dawn of order and prosperity. {^n}{^n} Led by a charismatic preacher known as Father Kymon and guarded by their faith
column4: the Chosen are eager to stamp out all corruption from Cairn
column5: whether it is vile Chthonic horrors or death-manipulating necromancers. To this end
column6: they consider ridding the world of the Order of Death's Vigil to be one of their utmost priorities.

16310=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagCharAttributeDescription01=A cunning intellect improves your combat technique
column2: increasing physical
column3: pierce
column4: bleed and internal trauma damage. Cunning also increases your chances of landing melee and ranged attacks
column5: and critically hitting enemies.

column1: 16312=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagCharAttributeDescription02=Physical conditioning gives you the strength to fight in heavier gear and the agility to avoid enemy attacks. Physique also increases your capacity for pain
column2: your ability to regenerate your wounds and the ability to avoid being critically hit.

column1: 16314=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagCharAttributeDescription03=A strong spirit increases the flow of energy into your being and allows you to withstand the spiritual burden of using more powerful enchanted items. Spirit also magnifies the damage of magical attacks.
16316=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagCharAttributeDescription04=Health is a measure of how much pain and damage you can withstand before you collapse or die.
16318=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagCharAttributeDescription05=Energy is a measure of your spirit's capacity to hold magical energies.  The greater this capacity
column2: the larger the pool of energy you can immediately draw upon before waiting to regenerate.

column1: 16341=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagCharStatsOADescription=A higher Offensive Ability (OA) increases your chance of successfully landing attacks and spells
column2: scoring critical hits
column3: and the damage of critical hits. An Offensive Ability lower than your opponent's Defensive Ability will greatly increase your chance to miss.  Offensive Ability is affected by skills
column4: items
column5: and Cunning.

column1: 16348=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagCharStatsDADescription=A higher Defensive Ability (DA) allows you to avoid enemy hits more often
column2: decreases the chance of suffering a critical hit and reduces the damage taken when you are critically hit. Defensive Ability is affected by skills
column3: items
column4: and Physique.

column1: 16406=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagCharStatsDPSDescription=Average damage per second for your Left-Mouse Button and Right-Mouse Button Abilities against a single target
column2: modified by cooldown and all bonuses from equipment and skills. Does not factor in enemy defenses.

column1: 16407=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagCharStatsDPSRightDescription=Damage breakdown for your Right-Mouse Button Ability against a single target
column2: modified by all bonuses from equipment and skills. Does not factor in enemy defenses.

column1: 16408=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagCharStatsDPSLeftDescription=Damage breakdown for your Left-Mouse Button Ability against a single target
column2: modified by all bonuses from equipment and skills. Does not factor in enemy defenses.
the less damage you will take from physical attacks. Bonuses on skills and on non-armor pieces are added to all armor slots.

column1: 16830=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagVendorTab02B=Everything from pistols pieced together from mismatched parts to old crossbows refitted with automatic rotary firing mechanisms.

column1: 16848=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagVendorRolloverDescription=Dealers profit from humankind's misfortune by selling salvaged or stolen goods to those who dare venture out beyond the human strongholds. It's best not to ask for an item's origins.

16942=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagDividerRoll01=The salvage chamber is used to strip component parts and Augments from items.  Unfortunately
column2: the process is imperfect and always results in the destruction of either the item or the component part but you can choose which one to salvage and which to sacrifice.{^n}{^n}If you salvage the item

column1: 18296=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagUPnPNotAvailableHelp=UPnP is not available.  Grim Dawn will not be able to auto-configure your router to Host an Internet server.  Please check your router settings and enable UPnP or manually configure your router to open port 27016 for both the UDP and TCP protocols.
18298=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagUPnPEnabledHelp=UPnP is enabled.  No manual configuration is needed.
18299=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagUPnPDisabledHelp=UPnP is disabled.  Port 27016 must be opened on your router for both the UDP and TCP protocols to host a Grim Dawn server.
18301=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagUPnPHelp=UPnP is a protocol that allows Grim Dawn to Communicate with and control your router.  To host an Internet server
column2: ports must be opened on your router.  UPnP allows Grim Dawn to open those ports
column3: and close them on exit
column4: with no manual configuration required.

column1: 18303=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagIPCheckHelp=The network configuration test checks that the local router has a valid external IP address
column2: and that the address matches the external address visible to the internet.

column1: 18305=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagIPCheckFail=The public IP address reported by your router does not match the public IP address externally visible to the Internet.  Usually
column2: this is caused by attempting to host a Grim Dawn Server from behind more than one router.  Please check your router configuration and restart Grim Dawn.

column1: 18307=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagIPCheckFailMaybe=The public IP address reported by your router (%t0) is not a valid IP address.  It is possible that your router is functioning properly and did not report the public IP correctly.  However
column2: if you are unable to host a Grim Dawn server
column3: please check your router configuration.  In particular
column4: you should check to make sure that the Grim Dawn server is not behind more than one router.  Some Internet providers use bundled modem/router devices.  If there is another router between the Grim Dawn server and the bundled device you will not be able to host an internet server.

column1: 18309=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagIPCheckPass=Network configuration test passed.  The public IP address reported by your router matches that which is externally visible on the internet.
18311=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagIPCheckUnable=Unable to test network configuration.  This check requires that the local router has the UPnP protocol enabled
column2: and that UPnP support is enabled in Grim Dawn.  If it is not enabled
column3: please enable it
column4: restart Grim Dawn
column5: and re-run this test.

column1: 18313=//records/davtxt.tekst=tagIPCheckUnableIP=Unable to obtain the externally visible IP address.  The test cannot be run at this time.
